author: {'steamid': '76561198073362767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2046, 'last_played': 1708568156}
review:
Iron Brigade, first released in the Microsoft Indie Arcade on Xbox 360 and begs for a sequel of some kind, or an extended cut.

 Iron Brigade still holds up well against modern day games, the graphics speak indie dev as it had back in the day when super meat boy held the title of best indie game. If you have a total of four players ready to grind at destroying tubes then your success at completing the game is much higher, although coordination and communication on how you set your trench up is most important. As players get into the late game, it becomes even more important to successfully plan your set up, the kind of trench you'll use, the cost of placements, the time you'll be able to place them, and the health of the team, all of it plays a part to yours and your teams success. 

Get this game, as a four pack and share it amongst your friends. if you enjoy a bit of tower defence and a bit of a horde like mode, i recommend this game for you and new players alike!!

author: {'steamid': '76561199383958315', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1392, 'last_played': 1706538313}
review:
Веселенька гра про боротьбу з пропагандонством і його телевізорами) Гравець виступає в ролі оператора мобільної бойової траншеї:D (Меха), щоб перемогти всесвітнє зло, про походження якого можна здогадатись з його імені - Владімір, а потім отримати остаточне підтвердження у вигляді фінального боса з доповнення (доповнення є безкоштовним і входить в базову версію гри в steam).

На вибір є 6 різних траншей:D, вибачте, шасі - від штурмових до інжерних, які дають змову підлаштувати проходження під себе. Різноманітна зброя від кулеметів, дробовиків і снайперських гвинтівок до гранатометів, лазерної зброї і АРТИЛЕРІЇ. Також в кожній траншеї:D кхм... Меху є, відповідно до типу, комірки для розміщення додаткових об'єктів на полі бою - від ремонтної вежі і автоматичного збирача телевізорів (телевізори - основний ресурс для крафу під час місій) до різноманітних турелей, ППО і мін. Також на вибір є кілька типів ніг для пересування.

Гра старенька і не треба від неї чекати якоїсь мегаграфіки чи інноваційного ігроладу, проте вона вартує того, щоб в неї пограти. Також, якщо хтось потребуватиме допомоги з досягненнями - звертайтесь)
Висновок: 10 телевізорів з 10 :)

                                                                                [h1]УВАГА!!![/h1]
 
В грі доступний КООП до 4-х людей, але під час мережевої гри присутні підвисання. В процесі одиночного проходження жодних технічних проблем не помічено

author: {'steamid': '76561198087532526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1720, 'last_played': 1708706814}
review:
[b]У даного проєкту є підвисання під час гри з друзями.[/b]
[b]У випадку коли граєте без інших учасників - жодних проблем немає.[/b]
[hr][/hr]

Ігролад
Це не тільки PvE на мехах, але й захист вежами. Що дає доволі цікавий досвід.
Є унікальні боси та приємні локації (враховувати що це старий проєкт і відповідна графіка).

Ви будете керувати своїм власним мехом з можливістю поставити на нього різне озброєння (кулемети, дробовики, артилерія, щось схоже на вогнемет [strike] але це не він [/strike], лазери, снайперські гвинтівки) та турелі (які теж бувають різноманітними).
Сюжет і фінальний бос залишає приємні емоції.

На мою думку - це справді цікавий проєкт з мехами, який варто спробувати.
Мені він однозначно сподобався і, планую, й надалі продовжувати до нього повертатись.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090172103', 'num_games_owned': 603, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 2567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2567, 'last_played': 1706500819}
review:
This is epitome of a 7/10 or 8/10 game. Great but it won't blow your mind or anything. It's a third-person shooter/strategy game that is light on both genres. It gets bogged down by a bunch of little things like: unskippable cut scenes and dialog, not having the ability to know what you already have from the store, no mini-map, etc.....
The story was terrible and never cared for it. In true Double Fine tradition the game tries too be funny. Love the fact that comes with the DLC which ads a whole new campaign and tons of extra stuff to unlock and survival modes. Better with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010543154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 5761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5003, 'last_played': 1705699354}
review:
While this game is borderline dead. Which is a massive shame. Since they removed the games for windows live software from it. It#s become amazing. No more FPS drops.
In case someone is wondering "what the heck is he on about"?
When this was a games for windows live title only. The GFWL software would memory leak like crazy. After 2 missions you'd be lucky to run at 10 FPS.
It's a brilliantly fun tower defence, third person shooter. That gets insanely hard in the later waves of survival mode.
Well worth every penny. Just wish there were more people to stomp with

author: {'steamid': '76561197966634175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 785, 'last_played': 1689501620}
review:
Iron Brigade is a gem of a TD title, with a playstyle that feels akin to Dungeon Defenders and a vibe and aesthetic that feels like it belongs beside Destroy All Humans and Stubbs the Zombie. The gameplay is challenging, albeit a bit repetitive, and across the board you can feel the passion behind this project, from the mechanics, to the design, to the purposefully cringe voice acting.

The only negative I would have to say is it feels dated. This is a title I'd love to see receive a full modernized remake or modern-era sequel, as it's all positives, but those positives do feel limited a decent amount by the constraints of the technology at the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052627837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1704832812}
review:
Évaluation basée sur le fait que pour moi, je n'ai jamais pu y jouer ! 
Premier problème : l'affichage : le menu était masqué parce que la résolution au lancement était inadaptée. Pas de fichier config pour solutionner le problème. Le SAV n'a pas trop su m'aider. J'ai fini par réussir, à voir une partie du menu, et changer la résolution, pas sans mal, la boîte de dialogue demandant si je veux conserver ces paramètres ne détectant pas ma souris 4 fois sur 5 quand elle passe sur le bouton. Les touches du clavier pas mieux. Enfin, après avoir trouvé une résolution qui semble adaptée, je met "commencer à jouer", et là, c'est le drame : bloqué sur la plage choix du personnage, même problème, les flèches ne réagissent pas à ma souris, ni au clavier. Je me serai contenté du premier protagoniste, mais entrée ne fait rien non plus. Bref, un fiasco, peut être mal adapté aux derniers windows. Ma config pour info : I7 12700 RTX 2080 SUPER, Win 11 pro 64.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205005597', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1697943931}
review:
フレンドと二人で協力プレイした感想。
タワーディフェンスゲームではあるけど、タワーをたくさん建てるほどの収入はなく、ほとんどプレイヤーが敵を撃ち殺していく。せっかく建てたタワーも敵に壊されてしまう。
敵は四方八方から防衛拠点を目指してくるが、タワーには任せられないので自分で歩き回って敵を倒していく。
しかしプレイヤーはマシンによる移動なので足が遅い。
安く買えるのでそこが救いか

author: {'steamid': '76561198149405816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9743, 'last_played': 1609743797}
review:
One of my favorite games of all time! I have completed this game 12 times, 9 times on Xbox and 3 on PC. I rarely give 9.5s (because no game is perfect at least in my opinion), BUT if you like loot, mechs, flashy explosions, and light Tower Defense elements then I think this is the game for you! You can play solo or with up to 4 friends, I recommend either one, playing a game with friends is always more fun, BUT I had a blast playing solo.

My score: 9.5/10

Summary: 
This is a 3rd person Mech "Arena" tower defense mission based game. What I mean is you progress through a linear set of missions completing each one to progress to the next. In each mission you'll be defending a "Base" from enemies, to do this you can spawn "Emplacements" which are turrets that will help you shoot them down or you can shoot them down yourself with your Mechs weapons. Each Mech Chassis can equip diffrent amounts of Weapons and "Emplacements", it's up to you on how you want to load your Mech out. Loot will drop from each mission so it's worth completing a mission multiple times to either get more loot or better loot by completing the mission with a better score.

Pros:
>9/10 Mech customization (Not exactly "Deep", but in my opinion just right)
>9/10 Weapon variety (Always fun to find a crazy new weapon that does something new)
>8/10 Total Missions
>8/10 Mission Modes (Base Defending / Boss Fights / Moving Bases / Survival)
>8/10 Story (For what this game is. Funny and I enjoyed it.)
>7/10 Enemy variety (Wish there were just a little more, but there are a lot)
>10/10 No micro-transactions 
>9/10 Fun! 

Cons:
>To restart a play through you have to delete your save data and remove cloud back up for this game. (Quite annoying, but worth it if you want to play through the game again from a blank slate)
>Expect to run around the map quite a bit to place "Emplacements" down and Upgrade them; however if you focus your Mech on Guns instead of the "Emplacements" you won't be running around as much and you can focus on shooting the enemies instead. (I have completed this game as a full Weapon focused Mech and "Emplacement" focused Mech)
>Mech movement feels a bit clunky at first. (I know this is a common problem some people have with the game, but it didn't really effect me as much and I got used to it pretty fast.)
>Post Campaign is mainly just getting Gold on every mission and surviving all levels on survival, but I enjoyed it overall, just wish there was more to play.

Notes:
Overall Iron Brigade has a special place in my heart back on the Xbox 360 and replaying it on my PC. It was fun in 2012 and it's still fun today and there isn't another game I can point to to say "That's a better Iron Brigade". All that being said Armored Core VI looks great and I can't wait to play it; however Iron Brigade still fills its own niche. I played the majority of the game solo, but I did also play with a couple of randoms and friends on different play throughs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117048245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3160, 'last_played': 1696812967}
review:
I cannot believe I never reviewed this game.  So I played it originally on Xbox360 (+200-hrs from that device -- it's from that era with its advantages and flaws; and by today's PCs it runs on everything; even a potato ;-).  This is a wonderful, quirky, unique adaptation of revisionist WWII in an alternate universe.  Simple, yes.  Limited tower choices, yes.  But remember it is:  1st = FPS and 2nd = Tower Defense (although there is a light trench (mech) which is the opposite).  I have had a blast with my family (adults) playing this back in 2013-2016 and again with my kids 2017-2020 (shooting "tubes" is much nicer than other games for younger kids).  The game is easy to pickup and learn for kids (limited choices) but there are just enough different weapons, gear, towers, and play styles to have decent variety.  The end-game Survival (100-rounds) is just difficult enough you might need to do a few special mission runs to get a good meta-weapon / trench / tower and fully customize yourself to beat it with 4-players.

I will always fondly remember good times with this one and highly recommend it to anyone for some quirky, light fun.  My kids and I would often quote some of the lines from this game, even years later.  "The tanks in Poland can take twice as much damage.  No complaints!"

Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198020313592', 'num_games_owned': 984, 'num_reviews': 574, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1691130761}
review:
[h1]Sum-Up[/h1]
[h3]In-depth analysis further down.[/h3]

[table]
[tr]
[th]🟩 [b]Pros[/b][/th]
[th]🟥 [b]Cons[/b][/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]
• Enjoyable progression, with tons of unique parts to craft a custom mech suited to your preferred playstyle.

• Combat is fast-paced, enjoyable and, at times, chaotic. The enemy variety is enough to not get stale.

• The quirky, over-the-top humor and tropes are well-done, not cringe, and quite entertaining.
[/td]
[td]
• Tremendously outdated visuals, even for a 2012 release. It looks and feels like an early PS2 title.

• Boss fights are underwhelming, way too easy and forgiving - much more so than normal levels.

• Huge quality-of-life issues: inability to sell towers, absence of enemy path indicators, no map, and many more.

• Balance issues with weapons and towers; you won’t use many of them, as they either suck or are worse versions of something else.

• No pause whatsoever at any point between waves, and you can’t see in advance what’s coming next in them.
[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

[table]
[tr]
[th]🟨 [b]Bugs & Issues[/b][/th]
[th]🔧 [b]Specs[/b][/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]
• 30 FPS hard cap, with no way to increase it whatsoever.

• Frequent disconnections while loading a level in co-op, and occasional crashes.

• The game anomalously interferes with voice clients (e.g. Discord), muting or impairing conversation while playing.

• Cutscenes in levels can’t be skipped: replaying means going through them each time.
[/td]
[td]
• i5 11400H
• 16GB RAM DDR4
• 512 GB SSD
• RTX 3060 6GB
• 1080p
[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

[table]
[tr]
[td][b]Content & Replay Value:[/b][/td]
[td]It took me, alongside my partner, about 8 hours to complete the campaign, getting Gold rating on most maps as well in the process. After that, the included Mars DLC is available for those interested, other than Survival (endless) mode for grinding and achievements. Content is however linear, and I don’t see much replay value after finishing things up.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Is it worth buying?[/b][/td]
[td]Not really. The price of 15€ isn’t bad for this content amount, especially for completionists, however there simply are many other, better alternatives in the same price range, to play in co-op. Sanctum 2, Orcs Must Die 2-3, Fortified, Hypercharge, Deathtrap… to name some.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]

[td][h3]Verdict: Mediocre[/h3]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2548409603]Rating Chart Here[/url][/td]
[td]Despite enjoyable progression and action-packed combat, Iron Brigade remains a flawed, annoying, jury-rigged TD/Shooter hybrid ultimately not worth your time.[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

[quote]Follow our Curator page, [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41449676/]Summit Reviews[/url], to see more high-quality reviews regularly.[/quote]

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3014517318

[h1]In-Depth[/h1]
[h3]Writing & Worldbuilding[/h3]
In-between the (at the time of writing) two World Wars, Iron Brigade takes a detour from reality and has an alien invasion come up unexpectedly. An unknown transmission dubbed “The Broadcast '' starts spawning nightmarish, CRT-themed creatures named Tubes, that quickly manage to overrun most militaries and lay waste to the planet, guided by their very human mastermind, Dr. Farnsworth. As part of the Mobile Trench Brigade, you’ll pilot the namesake mobile mechs against the Tube forces across all continents. 

The world depicted here is bleak, crumbling and polluted - as it should be after a conflict of this scale. The environments of each stage are decently-made, however there are no memorable landmarks or epic backgrounds to reinforce the world-building’s theme. Save for structures strictly there for gameplay purposes or level design, there won’t be much else to sight-see or notice. There’s also no environmental interaction or dynamicity in any of the proposed scenarios - all of it feels too stale and too still. Writing-wise, the over-the-top, quirky, humorous tone works pretty well, and somehow manages to maintain a shred of seriousness despite all the over-emphasized dialogues and one-liners. It’s enjoyable for what it is.

[h3]Customization & Progression System[/h3]
Your mobile base will be a large military ship that will serve as a central hub to invite other players, matchmake (good luck with that one), customize your Trench and Soldier both cosmetically and equipment-wise, trade stuff at the shop and of course, select missions. Building your own custom mech is fun; at each level up, and from loot boxes dropped by some enemies (don’t worry, they’re free!) you’ll gain and unlock new chassis styles, guns, turret types and cosmetics to create a veritable fighting machine. 

Each hull type has a different amount of Weapon and Emplacement (buildable turrets) slots, so that you may choose between a more combat-oriented or “builder” play-style - and then customize it further as you like. It’s not long to level-up, but with the cap being 20, you’ll barely reach 10 at the best of times by the end of the campaign - you’ll have to grind Survival and the DLC for more, which isn’t optimal progression design-wise.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3014517492

[h3]Building & Defending[/h3]
There won’t be any preparation phase or time to see the map’s layout and strategize: enemies, in each level, will start pouring from various spawn points just a few moments after starting out. Building turrets is quick and relatively cheap in most cases, but alas they can also be destroyed swiftly by dedicated enemies that will target them. All of this is quite annoying, as it doesn’t give the strategic aspect needed for a tower defense to work, and instead rushes players without any time to think of a strategy: we had to replay several levels because of this reason. 

The fact no enemy path-finding lines, a core feature in tower defense, are ever shown, or that you can’t anticipate waves if you wish to do so (for an extra reward), and that you can’t even sell or repair towers are all screw-ups that make the experience much more frustrating.

Your main goal will be defending one or more critical structures, or in Boss levels, defeating a particularly tough monster. You’ll be able to build defenses mostly anywhere, but sometimes they may land in a weird way and not shoot correctly, or clip into structures. The thing is, also, that you won’t really be using most defense types except machine guns or flaks, because they do everything, do it well, and your Trench takes care of the rest. Yes, 75%of the entire tower roster is either too expensive to be worth it, redundant or useless - same for weapons, you’ll really only be using sniper rifles and machine guns - we got Gold on most levels just doing that.

[h3]Combat System & Bosses[/h3]
Most enemies will just want to destroy your base, however some will either target exclusively players, and your death really means being out of commission for the level, or your towers. Specialized gear like Flak vs. Air foes are a plus, but hardly mandatory. You’ll want to equip your Trench with diverse weapons to deal with different threats not already accounted for by your towers: for instance, you’ll build a lot of machine guns or flaks, and then deal with heavy foes yourself. 

Mini-bosses also appear from time to time, but don't really feel unique except being more resistant, but also slower - they’re not an issue nor a challenge once you figure out the “meta” weapons that are just better than all others. The special abilities granted by leg modules, like Fortify, allowing you to hunker down and gain a major defense  bonus, or Stun Slam, are nice but ultimately, you will just use Quickload, that boosts your reload times tremendously, allowing you to dish out enormous DPS with heavier weapons - everything else pales in comparison.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3014344940

author: {'steamid': '76561198186530370', 'num_games_owned': 2632, 'num_reviews': 571, 'playtime_forever': 1308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1308, 'last_played': 1688995820}
review:
I don't even know how I came across this game. I mean, to all you reviewers, did you ever hear this game before, like anywhere, during a gaming conference and here I am, reviewing and actually spending a day of playtime in a game from 2012 (when most of our ancestors were still breathing). Anyway, jokes apart .. 

To be honest, being a lover of iron man and marvel likes, I just searched for iron term on search bar and one fine day, steam threw this kinda not-so-known or renowned game. Just the term iron. And it was not that bad, I was expecting a heart-touching storyline, some memory blown plot and forever ingrained cult game, but it was a really plain tower defense game. Right at the start and you are thrown in a playground to splitter-splatter hordes of enemies just using transformer like mech and your arsenal of four different types of weapons which you can pop by salvaging scraps from enemies. graphics have a cartoonish touch and lot of television lookalike inanimate objects because our innocent antagonist is a broadcaster based terrorist or a baddy killing goodies and you being goody entrusted with hip hopping our baddie. Being a tower defense, it is kinda simple. You don't really have to have a lot of understanding of environment, strategic placements of turrets and guns and add-ons. Just more you have, the easier it is. Enemies follow straightforward path to attack the base that you have to defend with your life you noobie.

An easily passable and defeatable game. However, levels don't bring much variation, nor in combat neither in environment, every level look and feel almost same. So, yeah, gradually you will begin to wear off. If you are a fan of mechs and robots and transformers, then I will suggest its a one-time play. 

There are tons and myriads of better game than this one but if you are out of budget for a month, then I will thank steam for suggesting me this game. Best bought in sale. I will give 6 mechs out of 10 to this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101617080', 'num_games_owned': 427, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1692300968}
review:
Its been over a decade, and this is still the absolute best Action Tower Defense game I've played
I wish it wasn't so old though, because there are still some issues and it has most certainly been abandoned; by devs and players. So no updates, patches, new content, or even other players for matchmaking.

Orcs Must Die, Dungeon Defenders, Sanctum, Gross, Rift Breaker, They Are Billions, Xmorph, Fortified;
I've played them ALL, and they're all good, some even great,
but Iron Brigade is my #1 all-time favorite

I recommend it 10,000% to anyone who likes Tower Defense, any of the games named above, or has a pulse.
Just get it on sale, and get the 4 pack so you can at least try the MP with friends

author: {'steamid': '76561198275067527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1993, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1901, 'last_played': 1679331902}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971367114', 'num_games_owned': 481, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1679518338}
review:
Fun game honestly, not for everyone especially during now when most just want to be guided and told to hit a target and when to change their diapers but ya'know game is fun, got enough mechanics that can give you some challenge, story line mhm ironically its funny knock at the media type of thing idk how to really put it that would make sense and not go against any terms of service. 

Mech's combat and customization is pretty decent honestly still enjoy till this day, wish this game got a sequel but with a bigger budget and more respect while keeping similar gameplay. Tower defense aspect of the game is interesting takes some getting used to if your not used to thinking-using that hunk of meat in your head. If anything its open to different playstyles including a variety of weaponry. Ex; Snipers, Machine guns, broadcasters, bombardments and some more. Mech variety could do with some work but there's Mech body and legs that suit most playstyles, admittedly one is more OP than the other. I used to play on Xbox 360 so my hours here dont actually dictate hours played give or take 500hrs+ played a ton with friends and always worked to get to a 100 waves.

I'd say game is about 6.9/10 by today's standards 5.6/10. It's 3/10 though for your average joe cause unfortunately to open up your multiplayer experience a bit going to have to go through editing that config file.... I was finding no players regardless if theres was people online playing played most of the game by myself until about 4 days ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113099945', 'num_games_owned': 645, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1678523249}
review:
This is such a gem and I regret not having known about it sooner. It is a 4-player Online Co-Operative Tower Defense game where you each pilot and customize your own Mech from the 3rd Person view. It's such a great premise, the levels are challenging and the prerequisites to get Gold Medals on each mission scales with the amount of players which means it's not a cake walk with more people. It's fun strategizing with your friends and choosing different Mech chassis as well as different tower defense emplacements to compliment one another. This is essentially a better version of Sanctum/ Orcs Must Die! 2. There is also an endless survival mode after you beat the game and an included additional DLC campaign so there is some replay-ability.

 Yes, the game looks a little dated but it plays great and the online multiplayer functions flawlessly (please note you have to complete the Tutorial and Beach level to play MP). For $15 this is probably the most fun I've had in a long while and it's sad that I'm finding out about it more than a decade after release. If there was any complaint I had about the game is that DoubleFine has not released a sequel yet because I want to play more of this game!

review: Probably the best tower defense game on the market! Great aesthetic, funny humor, overall a great game to play with a friend. My only gripe though is the game crashes whenever we started a online match. Only way we found out to override this problem was to start the game up in windows mode. author: {'steamid': '76561198070737120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1165, 'last_played': 1674880429}
review: Not gonna lie, there's a few things that this game could definitely do better. This experience is definitely best with friends, but damn is it fun. You will find yourselves trying to create team builds as opposed to min maxing your kit. Having everyone on the team rocking a role of their own is super rad. The game was very obviously designed for 3 people (3 chassis types, 3 characters, 3 legs) and that's what we played with. But if you can find a 4th I'd say go for it. This game is tons of fun, and I'm glad I came back and played it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049689426', 'num_games_owned': 1115, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 716, 'last_played': 1515279939}
review:
Tower defense z elementami gry akcji. Dwóch naukowców dostało się w zasięg pozaziemskiej fali radiowej, która zmieniła ich w (nieco szalonych) geniuszy-wynalazców. Jeden z nich zaczął tworzyć em... armię samobieżnych telewizorów, z pomocą których dąży do panowania nad światem. Drugi natomiast poszedł nieco bardziej tradycyjną ścieżką - jego arsenał to wieżyczki i mobilne okopy (czyli mechy z czymś przypominającym stanowisko snajperskie na szczycie). Gracz kieruje operatorem rzeczonego mecha i jego zadanie jest (w teorii) proste - umiejętnie rozmieszczając wieżyczki i osobiście uczestnicząc w walce, bronić określone cele przed zalewem telewizorów.

Rozgrywka przypomina Dungeon Defenders lub Orcs Must Die - tu również obserwujemy świat z perspektywy trzeciej osoby, walczymy z kolejnymi falami wrogów wyłaniających się z portali i podróżujących wytyczonymi ścieżkami, w miarę możliwości i wolnych funduszy dostawiając kolejne wieżyczki. Nic nie stoi również na przeszkodzie, aby osobiście pofatygować się do przeciwnika i ciepło go przywitać (najlepiej ogniem z sześciu luf). Pomiędzy mapami trafiamy do okrętu-bazy. Tu mamy możliwość przezbroić naszego mecha - zmienić jego typ (od czego zależy obrona, prędkość oraz liczba możliwych do zabrania broni i wieżyczek), jak również dokonać wyboru samych narzędzi zagłady, jakie zabierzemy na kolejne misje. Nowe typy uzbrojenia odblokowują się w miarę zaliczania kolejnych poziomów - część wypada z przeciwników, część można zakupić w sklepie.

Iron Brigade to bardzo przyjemna propozycja dla miłośników gatunku. Spora liczba broni i wieżyczek do wyboru pozwoli dopasować ekwipunek do stylu gry i wymagań danego poziomu, a oprawa audiowizualna uprzyjemnia rozgrywkę. Największymi wadami jest nieco toporne sterowanie mechem (chodzi wolno, a sprint nieraz powodował zacięcie się gdzieś w zakamarkach poziomu) oraz brak mapy i radaru w trakcie starcia (dostępna jest jedynie mapka poglądowa przy wyborze poziomu w bazie). Sama rozgrywka jest również momentami nieco powolna i pod koniec zaczęła mnie już nużyć. Mimo to - polecam.

Współpracuję z portalem https://www.jrkrpg.pl/ - nieformalnym i ciągle uzupełnianym przez ochotników leksykonem gier RPG wszelkiej maści i pochodzenia. Zapraszam do wizyty (a może i współtworzenia?).

[quote][h1]Zapraszam do obserwacji naszego kuratora: [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/26553378/] ŚWIAT RECENZJI[/url][/h1][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198284731206', 'num_games_owned': 1604, 'num_reviews': 504, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1674416496}
review:
[h1]It's like Sanctum2 and Mechwarrior5 had a baby...
a really really stupid baby...[/h1]
Pros: [b]#1.[/b] It has voice acting, which is cool I guess

Cons: [b]#1.[/b] Loot disappears
[b]#2.[/b] The creativity and freedom of the player is massive limited by the fact that turret slots on the mech are color-locked.
[b]#3.[/b] Loot disappears
[b]#4.[/b] You're given way too little down-time between rounds
[b]#5.[/b] Loot disappears
[b]#6.[/b] The dps of a weapon isn't shown, so you have to calculate it yourself to see which weapon does the most dmg
[b]#7.[/b] Loot disappears
[b]#8.[/b] The windowed mode and fullscreen mode of the game is borked and the game freaks out when you switch modes (the mouse becomes unresponsive sometimes and other times your game just crashes).
[b]#9.[/b] Loot disappears
[b]#10.[/b] Can't set the FPS of the game
[b]#11.[/b] Loot disappears

Seriously though... the fact that loot disappears is the biggest issue BY FAR... if that was fixed that I could potentially look last the bad points of the game, but it's not fixed, so I can't come even close to recommending it. Go play Sanctum2 and just put a video of "1hour of tank sounds" on in the background or something... you'd be much better off than playing this game.

For more reviews, visit my curator page: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/7851637/
For my full recommended list of games: https://steamcommunity.com/id/lfpg/recommended/

author: {'steamid': '76561198086976043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1674002766}
review:
Welcome to Africa, marine.

The cable has led us to a small oasis in the middle of the Desert, which seems to be a good place to set up camp, as it's our only access to fresh water in miles.

Locals report packs of Knobs in the area, so you may want to bring an automatic weapon.

And try not to blow up all the palm trees. The chef wants to make a special "Welcome to Africa" coconut dessert tonight.

10/10, would go to Africa again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049823783', 'num_games_owned': 1712, 'num_reviews': 1265, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1673721205}
review:
Es un TD en el que operas un robot y vas poniendo Torres ademas de que el robot que operas tiene armas y vas disparando a enemigos para defender los objetivos que te plantean (los bichos te dropean puntos para poner mas torretas) el robot puede ser mejorado y cambiadas las armas, hay bichos bastante bien logrados a nivel estetico y la jugabilidad no esta mal en si, es bastante raro encontrar TDS donde vos sos un personaje jugable en el entorno, pero el juego si bien tiene algunas cosas safables, realmente es muy pobre en todo lo demas, lore, duracion, graficos... Musica ni hablar.. jugabilidad generica.

Podria haber sido una propuesta interesante pero se siente a mitad de camino, lo peor de todo es que no tiene ni cromos.

3.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198369046267', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 847, 'last_played': 1709962843}
review:
dont listen to other reviews, alot of people just dont seem to like this game because "its too hard" mother fucking bring it on, people also complain about having too "collect scrap" if its really a god damn issue then USE THE EMPLACMENT WHICH PICKS SCRAP UP FOR YOU, this game is a god damn blast, and i highly reccomend, it runs good, its also NOT capped to 60 fps like some say, it supports good resolutions, its really god damn fun, the storys good, and the gameplay keeps you on your toes, there is shit tons of viable playstyles, and most negative reviews i see come down to people just not likeing that its a towerdefense combined with a cool ass 3rd person mech shooter, there is a weapon for every one in this game, and if you cant enjoy this game at all, your not human, this game is not for everyone tho, the gameplay is god damn brutal, and if you fuck up you get less shit, but this lends to it being fun and quite replayable, as with replaying it you can find better strategies and weapons, also dont listen to shit saying it uses GFWL or Games For Windows Live, it dosent, they switched to steam severs in around 2015.

TL:DR its fun, runs good, is a bit hard, and is from the golden era of games where every single little thing is perfect. i CANNOT HIGHLY ENOUGH reccomend this masterpiece of a videogame, god damn it deserves a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198230450188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 4958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2478, 'last_played': 1672136206}
review:
トーチカに足が生えたようなロボに乗り、
呼び出した様々なタレットと共に戦う迎撃TPS。
キャンペーン、サバイバルの2モードがあり、
どちらもオンラインco-op(野良、フレンド)が可能。
元はXbox用ゲームなので、パッドでも十分遊べる。

〇ソロとco-opの違い
・スクラップ取得時の増加量。
　co-opでは1人が1個スクラップを拾うと、
　人数で割った数が全員に配られる。
　また、初期スクラップ所持量が減る。

・敵の数と体力。
　co-op時の方が数が多く、体力も高い。
　味方の人数に応じてさらに増加するが、
　取得できるスクラップが増えるメリットもある。

・復活システム。
　ソロでは連打で何回でも復活できるが、
　co-opでは誰かに起こしてもらう必要がある。
　全員が倒れると即ゲームオーバー。

〇良い点
・レトロ感溢れるロボ「トレンチ」。
　搭乗するロボは頭も腕もない無骨なタイプ。
　排気を吹きながらガションガション歩く。
　武器はほぼ実弾、一部だけ非実弾だが、
　基本的にレトロな見た目で統一されている。
　搭乗者が剥き出しだが、無敵なので問題ない。

・機体カスタマイズが可能。
(1)本体
　このパーツによって耐久力、スピード、
　武器&タレットスロットが決定される。
　標準型、火力型、工兵型の3系統があり、
　同じ系統でも武器・タレット枠が違うことがある。
(2)足
　ダッシュ、踏みつけ攻撃、固定砲台化など、
　それぞれが固有のレッグアビリティを持ち、
　戦場で無制限に使用可能。
　本体と違い、基礎パラメータには影響しない。
(3)武器
　マシンガンやキャノンといった火砲。
　本体左右の武器スロットに装着する。
　それぞれに1~3のサイズが設定されており、
　サイズと同じ数の片側のスロットを占有する。
　よって、左右1スロットづつの本体より、
　片側2スロットの本体の方が良い武器を装着可能。
　一方、攻撃は左トリガーで左武器一斉攻撃、
　右トリガーで右武器一斉攻撃になっているので、
　左右にスロットが分かれている方が
　残弾を管理しやすく、隙が少ないと言える。
(4)タレット
　自動で攻撃したり補助効果を発揮する砲台。
　軽攻撃・重攻撃・補助の3種があり、
　本体のタレットスロットに装着する。
　戦闘中に敵を倒して得たスクラップを使い、
　指定した場所に要請して配置する。
　配置した当初はレベル1だが、追加費用を払い
　最大でレベル3までアップグレードできる。
　本体によって消費スクラップに差があり、
　工兵型は少なく、火力型は多くなっている。
　ほとんどの敵からは攻撃されないが、
　水色の敵や一部の中ボスからは攻撃され、
　ダメージが嵩めば破壊される点に注意。
　陸戦型の中ボスの進路上に設置してあると、
　踏まれて即破壊されてしまう。
　スクラップ自動収集機と地雷散布機は
　ステルス機能があるので破壊されない。

・敵の攻撃対象が分かりやすい。
　基本的に青い敵は拠点を、赤い敵は自機を、
　水色の敵はタレットを攻撃する。
　これはあくまで攻撃の優先順位でしかなく、
　射撃機は無視する場合もあるが、
　ほとんどの敵はこれを徹底するので戦いやすい。

〇アレな点
・戦闘中にマップが見られない。
　ブリーフィングで上空写真を見られるが、
　高低差や詳細が分からず、かなり見にくい。
　戦闘に入るとマップを見られず、敵の発見は
　基本的に目視でしか行えない。
　(出現警報が少しぐらいはある。)
　マップはどのステージも結構広いので、
　一人ではなかなかカバーしきれない。

・スクラップ回収が面倒。
　敵を倒した後にドロップするスクラップが、
　高さによっては結構飛び散ってしまう。
　ゲームの仕様上、定点で全て迎撃しきることは
　不可能なので、後の回収が非常に大変。
　しかも未回収のスクラップは時間経過で消える。
　補助タレットにスクラップ自動収集機があるが、
　それを置くのにもスクラップを使う。

・ジャンプがない。
　マップには段差で区切られているところがある。
　自機はジャンプできないので、一度降りると
　かなり遠回りして戻らないといけなくなることも。
　ロボデザから考えればジャンプ不可で当然だが、
　やはり不便ではある。

・戦闘中のカットシーンを飛ばせない。
　新しい敵が出て来た時やボスの出現時などに
　ムービーが入ることがあるが、スキップ出来ない。
　ドロップ品の収集目的で周回する場合、
　カットシーンだけで結構な時間がかかってしまう。
　ボスステージ後のムービーだけは飛ばせる。

一人でも遊べるがちょっと大変なので、
co-opで遊べる友人がいれば非常にオススメ。
難しい操作やテクニックもないので操作も簡単。
co-opでは1人当たりのスクラップ入手量が減るが、
誰かが拾えば全員に同じ量が行き渡るし、
敵の数自体が増えるので、取得できる総量は増える。
他プレイヤーが置いたタレットも強化できるので、
編成にかなり融通が利くようになる。
ソロでは活躍し難かった標準型が輝くかも?

author: {'steamid': '76561198032649576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 684, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1708878122}
review:
At first I thought it was unbalanced buggy garbage.
The game is focused on co-op which is long dead, what did the creators expect.
There is no mini map. And often you don't know if there are enemies and if you missed their exit from where.
In some levels, the terrain is large, the towers are quite expensive, considering that the upgrade costs double, and they can be destroyed, but not removed by the player and not repaired. And there are only a few seconds left for deployment. 
And resource gathering sucks. You are like a magnet with a short range in a big map with a short time.
You have a choice of a strong robot that is similar to a tank and so slow.
Or medium strong towers with more variety given that there are only 3 classes and you can only have up to 4 types of towers. Robots are always better than towers. More weapons or bigger more damage.
The shop sells old and no longer needed things. There are more good things in the level. But unfortunately the shop is not upgraded and lags significantly even at the end, I think it's a bug. You need some things though.
The first 3 parts are not so bad, maybe in the beginning. But the fourth one that was added later is unbalanced garbage.
The game depends on the better weapons, when the store does not work properly, it is a matter of luck and always in the next level.
And you only get a little help in some levels from all the useless army and cannons behind your back.
It is also quite short without the last fourth part which is for grinding.
If the creators had really tried it would have been quite good, but it is not.
Pretty weak tower defense game.

review: I played this game as a kid, and this is what got me into gaming, and kaiju/mech based stuff. I wasn't expecting it to live up to what i thought it was, but it exceeded my expectations by a lot, If you are contemplating to get the game, you should. I originally played on xbox, but this has much more in it, including guns, mech chassis, maps, and possibly more tubes, I haven't played the DLC yet, as I am trying not to play through in one day. This is a must have game for any generation of gamers. Old enough to appeal to to the older generations, and action packed enough to have the younger generations show interest. This game has so much in it, strategy, action, comedic lines, and stressful situations, and to top it off, you can play with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042644971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1657652339}
review:
有些失望但不至于差评。有人一起玩的话算是个能欢乐几小时的东西，自己玩大概会感到空虚。建议等史低。

数据失衡导致选项看着很多其实就一种配置可用，塔防的部分意义不大主要是TPS。
有些敌人需要用爆炸破甲，只有榴弹炮/重炮/重型炮塔能破甲，但这些武器对空完全无能，必须有轻型炮塔或者至少两个武器槽给机枪，辅助槽需要至少一个装修理站。只有一个身体能满足这一点，完全毁掉了自由度。
机制发掘太浅了。既然是“腿”我比较期待“跳”这个功能，既然是“塔防”我比较期待“堵路”这个机制。但都没有。就是个能放机枪塔的tps。而且还没有雷达，经常打着一边被另一边偷家。

机甲：左3右3轻型+辅助的身体（Karlsson）+蹲射腿（Tripod Legs）。
武器：连狙+机枪，榴弹+机枪。
炮塔：机枪塔+磁铁花/修理站。

author: {'steamid': '76561198881171625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1657342718}
review:
*Esta Copado porque:
+ Es un tower defense que se juega en tercera persona con un pilotaje de mechas.
+ Estéticamente y gráficamente (para un juego de xbox arcade del 2011) esta muy simpático.
+ Es double fine, siempre hay que darle una oportunidad a sus juegos, es un estudio que sabe.
+ Tiene coop de a 4 y se nota que fue pensado para jugarlo asi.
+ El diseño de los monstruo monovisores o teletubo estan bien y los mechas que manejamos se ven geniales por el armamento que le podemos equipar y como cambian sus modelos.
+ Los jefes de las zonas funcionan bien y los mapas se juegan bien.
+ Sinceramente le doy positivo porque no existe la opción de punto medio y en oferta vale la pena sus 9 horas de duración.
+ Las Mobile Trench que usamos tienen cantidad de armamento y se puede variar tanto su estilo de juego que da mucha rejugabilidad.

*No esta Copado porque:
- Sinceramente tanto como shooter y tower defense flojea muchísimo al punto que envejeció mal, ya que:
1º- Como shooter falta fuerza en los impactos lo que deja  mucho que desear, ademas que te deja la sensación que siempre  falta potencia de fuego para exterminar cualquier unidad enemiga, sobretodo si no traes equipado un mecha grande con mínimo 4 ametralladoras o cañones sniper o artillería.
2º- Como juego de defensa comete el horrible error de limitar las torres que podes llevar, desde el tipo (3 en total siendo el azul inútil casi siempre) y la cantidad (entre 2 y 4). Ademas de esto son pocas las torretas que en verdad sirven, sumado al echo que igual que las armas muchas se sienten débiles y son solo un apoyo.
- Las animaciones están todas tiesas, sumado a lo mal optimizado y limite de 30 fps.
- El sonido por momentos parece que te explota los parlantes y es muy repetitivo por su calidad tan baja. Por lo menos las actuaciones de voz y la música están simpáticas.
- Esta muy pensado para el cooperativo.
- La movilidad no es un problema, sino fuera que tenes que buscar los materiales a la conciencia del mono.
- Las piernas definen una habilidad extra del mecha: Correr, modo tirador y pisotón. La idea es buena pero las trincheras deberían tener esas habilidades de por si y las piernas ser mejoras que se enfocan en un estilo de juego mas que otra tonta limitante.

review:
Pretty cool game until you try to play through it again and the main good guy and bad guy won't stop talking as slowly as they possibly can, and you can't skip it. It's frustrating on the bosses because if you are replaying the boss missions you are trying to get the time score and when they blather on for longer than the fight takes it starts to really grind on the nerves. 

All in all this is a cool little game with some replay value that is hampered by the game's desire for you to listen to the absolutely boring and vague machinations of some guy with a stupid, psychonauts beard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005087135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 1441465547}
review:
Definitely one of those "under the radar" type games that a lot of people don't know about.

A little short but an amazingly well done "Double Fine" game that takes a customizable mech 3rd person shooter and mixes it with RTS and tower defense, and pulls it all off amazingly well with a silly and cartoonish story that just makes it all the more fun.

And since they removed GFWL it actually works on steam and is even more fun in co-op.

10 years later and there still has not been a game like this.

I really hope we someday get a remaster or "IRON BRIGADE 2".

author: {'steamid': '76561198041603555', 'num_games_owned': 1621, 'num_reviews': 454, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1646030786}
review:
Iron Brigade, which was at one time named "Trenched", is one of the first Action / Tower Defense games, where you not only hold your "base" against waves of attackers by building various defense turrets, you also participate in the combat with your own weapons. And this one is in 3D!

The story is almost a lampoon of the golden age of scifi. Two childhood friends were exposed to some sort of alien broadcast and gained super intelligence. One engineered robotic legs for disabled soldiers. The other invented the television (well ahead of our prime timeline) and decided to network the world... no matter what's in the way, by creating a new set of robots known as monovisions, or "the tubes", to do his bidding, and no army can stand against the robots. The first turned his robot legs into "mobile trench" weapon platform, where a soldier can command these weapon platforms, with mechanical legs for mobility, and ability to drop emplacements (turrets) to assist in defense. Now, the former best friends must do battle across the world, and you are a new recruit in the Mobile Trench Brigade. As you gain experience, you will unlock new weapons, new chassis, new legs, new emplacements (turrets) as well as new outfits, and other customizations both for your trench and yourself. 

The game is unique for the time in that you can customize the loadout on each trench, and has the ability to assign different weapons to different sides, and given the Xbox controller has two triggers, have them fire separately. The enemy will shoot back and some are designed specifically to destroy your turrets. Others are going after your trench. Yet others are going after your base. 

The game is much tougher than it looks, even in the beginning levels, and there is no difficulty level selector. And really needs other players, and up to 3 others can join you. 

All in all, a game that's a little ahead of its time. Worth trying.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997381821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2792, 'last_played': 1645920166}
review:
Barely a positive for this effort.

I love DoubleFine Games. Big fan indeed. I snatched this up since I love tower defense games and DF.

After completing this somewhat short game I'm barely giving it a positive review.

Why? Here's why:

Pros:

-Humor
-Character designs
-Level designs
-Story
-VO work. Especially the legendary Phil LaMarr!

Cons:

-Can't sell turrets. !? This is the first TD Ive ever played where you cant sell towers/turrets. At least give me the option to remove it. 
-Scraps. You have to drudge your slow mech all over the place to vaccuum up after kills. Sure there’s a turret for this but it doesnt always pick  up all the scraps in its AoE. Scraps get caught in things and it makes the collector turrets worthless.
-Time between rounds is short. Ten seconds? Dumb.
-Turret and chassis upgrades are limited. Only the armor, slots and speed are different. Some can only carry light turrets or heavy turrets or tertiary turrets.
-Weapons have few stats displayed. Aside from caliber and distance there is no other info displayed about each weapon. No reload time, ammo capacity, etc. They don’t even explain some of the special abilities some of them have. It’s a guessing game.
-Turrets aren't much different from one another. Aside from distance and caliber some have special abilities but those are few and far between.
-Legs are limited to 3 types.
-Turret placement is limited to where they can be placed and placed near each other.
-Turrets are weak and are easily destroyed; even when theyre upgraded.
-Chassis variety is limited. There are different types and then there are 5 levels for each of them that only improves the armor and speed.
-Cut scenes can't be skipped.
-Only a few survival scenes available.
-Turrets don't always hit targets. Sometimes they don't always fire at all.
-Turrets cannot be customized at all. They only upgrade the damage and AoE at 3 levels. And barely at that.
-No CC or CD or procs for chassis or turrets or weapons.
-Head gear and jackets are superficial (but hilarious).
-No music.
-Crashes. I had load screen crashes; general in-games crashes and start-up issues. It didn't happen much but often enough.
-For a game made in the past decade it didn't look the least bit impressive even with settings at the highest.

There are more pros and cons but the game was frustrating at times and the controls are limited. You can't even remap mouse buttons.

It's a shame. This game could've been great:  A truly fun and exciting TD game but it was more of an unpolished game and maybe even an afterthought of something bigger.

Still, the humor and challenge might be enough to purchase at discount for TD fans mostly.

6/10.

review: I've played this game since it was released on Xbox 360. and I still love it today. PC version has a bit of stutter issues here and there, but nothing serious or game breaking. Fun game play, good balancing and design. Overall, just fun. Old fashioned style gaming fun where you just launch a game, it works, and you shoot stuff. Simple. Highly recommenced.

review:
It's Trenched! Except it's not "Trenched" they rebranded as Iron Brigade because of... reasons.

It's a Tower Defense game with a twist: you are a unit on the battlefield. You customize your walker to go and blast monsters and pick which turrets and where to place them. There's co-op for up to four players across the whole campaign.

What's not to love?

review:
レビューではなくゲーム開始時にエラーが出たので対処法を書き残す

ゲームのアイコンをマウスでクリックしても起動しない場合、ローカルファイルから直接ゲームを実行してエラーを確認する
エラー内容が　MSVCR100.DLL　関係だった場合、VCのランタイムが必要だが、2015以降では動かない

2005～2013までを手あたり次第入れたので、どれが該当するかは不明だが、とりあえずエラーはでなくなり
ゲームが無事に起動した

review: Mechs and tower defense, it's a combination that you can't go wrong with, though I do dislike how somewhat slipshod the tower defense segments are. Honestly, I think Sanctum did a better job of integrating the two concepts, but I don't think Iron Brigade did a bad job. It's still fun, but it's a jack of all trades. Doesn't master either idea, but it's good for variety.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053792078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1816, 'last_played': 1634572012}
review:
A wonderful left abandoned by time, I used to play this on Xbox and sometimes return to it on the PC. It's a curious mix of third person shooter and a non-grid tower defence that has a considerable amount of customisation and though it can get repetitive, can still find little ways to challenge you.

I would severely recommend this game if there were more people playing, but alas, it's time has been long gone. Who knows, maybe a sequel could formulate, improving on every step these giant mechanical trenches have taken.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049840197', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 383, 'playtime_forever': 1176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1176, 'last_played': 1593676317}
review:
Tower defense games are a personal weakness of mine. 
Probably from years spent playing them on Minieclips.com or something as a kid. 

And Iron Brigade is probably one of the best ones.
Because instead of just sitting on your ass watching sentry turrets do all the work, you get to pilot a huge diesel punk battle mech and paste your enemies with a giant fuck off cannon.  

Seriously this game is a blast, especially if you play it in co-op. 
There's a lot of personality in the designs. The Tubes all look like something out of a Lovecraft novel, weird undiscrible oozing masses of black slime, wires and unearthly pale glowing lights. 

Also the dialogue is pretty funny, not Double Fine's best but its pretty good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157261738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 773, 'last_played': 1641690313}

author: {'steamid': '76561198111014638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3188, 'last_played': 1593134906}
review:
53 hours on Steam, unknown large amount of hours on the Xbox 360. I love Iron Brigade, had to come back for more.

1- The game can get repetitive, but it's replay value with friends is outstanding in my honest opinion. I frequently have the hankering to play with my longtime IB friend, and i still feel the same about it after all these years.
2- For what it's worth, I think the price is extremely fair.
3- If you're into killing robots and enjoy tower defense, Highly recommend.
4- It can be a bit wonky at times, but it's an older hidden treasure, so I'm very much able to look beyond that.

TLDR; as long as you have buddies to play with, you will probably enjoy the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11126, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1703790346}
review:
Iron Brigade was a promising hybrid TV-punk third person mecha shooter/tower defense game.  Gameplay consists of 3D rendered third person vehicle shooter stuff, plus building towers, etc etc. 

While the premise was promising, this was a console port and had a lot of technical deficiencies as a result, like being locked to 30fps (because console peasants can't see any more than that).   Also, Games For Windows Live, remember that?  Once more, consoles make gaming worse for everyone.

I use the past tense to refer to this game because it doesn't launch, it just hangs at a black screen, and the developers have abandoned the game, it won't be fixed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970739339', 'num_games_owned': 674, 'num_reviews': 564, 'playtime_forever': 1484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1484, 'last_played': 1626417812}
review:
Iron Brigade is an entertaining and surprisingly in-depth hybrid of third person shooter and tower defense that remains one of my favorite titles to come out of the roughshod Xbox Live Arcade era, along with things like Warhammer 40k: Kill Team and the Scott Pilgrim game. It's fortunate that it got a Steam release, as there is every possibility the game would be lost to history now otherwise- or at least merely whispered of on emulation forums.

I first played IB years ago at the time of its original XBLA release in 2011, when it was under its former name of Trenched, which it had until a legal entanglement involving a similarly-named, irrelevant board game. It later came to Steam under the current name with the Rise of the Martian Bear DLC included, and eventually even had Games For Windows Live removed and replaced with Steamworks. Other titles with that particular millstone around their necks have not always been so fortunate, such as Lost Planet 2.

For those not in the know, Iron Brigade has a little story behind its development. During a time when Double Fine's troubled but unique heavy metal opera Brutal Legend had no publisher, Tim Schafer ran a morale-boosting exercise wherein he had the studio split into four teams and had them come up with ideas for games in a two week period known as the "Amensia Fortnight." Later, after EA ran Brutal Legend into the ground by suppressing all information regarding its multiplayer mode, considered by Double Fine to be the game's main offering, the Amnesia Fortnight prototypes were revisited and each was finished and published. Of these, Iron Brigade, Costume Quest and Stacking can all be found on Steam today, while Sesame Street: Once Upon A Monster remained a 360 exclusive.

Iron Brigade is thematically based on the testosterone-infused men's magazines of the 1940s and 50s, and depicts and alternate mid-20th century. Two fighting men, Frank Woodruff and Vladimir Farnsworth, after losing their legs in the Great War, served in a radio intelligence station in the Pacific. This station was affected by a mysterious and powerful signal we know only as The Broadcast, that fried the minds of everyone on the base except Frank and Vlad, who instead gained superhuman intelligence. Frank used his knowledge to design and build the Mobile Trenches, crude, but powerful internal-combustion-powered bipedal tanks that he intended for crippled soldiers to walk again. Vlad, on the other hand, created Monovision- a means to bring the world to the people instead. But something went wrong. From Monovision came the Tubes- monstrous creatures of wire and static bent on destruction. Whether the Tubes caused Farnsworth to go mad or they were born from his madness themselves does not matter. What matters is that Woodruff and his Mobile Trench Brigade are the only ones who can stop him. That's where you come in.

The game has 20-ish levels total spread across four chapters: Europe, Africa, the Pacific and Mars. Each level tends to introduce one new enemy type or environmental mechanic to keep things interesting, as well as change the arrangement of enemy spawn points and defense objectives, of which there can be between one and three. There are a wide variety of enemies, from simple running Resisters and shooting Tommys to flying Aerials, grenade-firing Burst Transmitters that target your turrets, and angry red Blitzers and Solenoids that ignore structures and instead target the players, and more. There are also boss-type tubes that can do things like spawn lesser Tubes or shell the objective from a long way away. It is worth noting that the Mars levels are considerably harder then the base game's campaign and resulted in a long delay in my getting to finish the game overall when combined with extenuating life circumstances and connection issues faced by my usual friend group.

To properly combat the Tubes you can alter the configuration of your Trench to a large degree, with up to six weapon hardpoints or up four types of turrets depending on your core chassis, with different legs providing supplementary abilities such as sprinting, or deploying your trench to become a turret yourself, with faster weapon reloading. Bigger Trench weapons can take two or even three hardpoints. Aside from carrying more guns, heavy trenches move slower and have more armor, but pay more scrap to build and upgrade turrets, while the inverse is true for engineering chassis, with standard chassis in the middle.

In between levels you can configure your Trench, emote at other players and just kind of run around the deck of the amphibious carrier USS Mckinley. You can change the paintjob on your trench, which of the four pilots you're playing and what their wearing, though oddly only changing their hat affects anything- and only which emotes they can do.

A friend of mine pointed out while playing coop with me that Iron Brigade would benefit greatly from an upgraded remake or updated rerelease of some description, to shake out the dust of its XBLA vintage and build upon its core concepts, perhaps with more levels, trench parts, enemies, that sort of thing. As a generally quality title, I cannot disagree. Aside from some occasional netcode hiccups that results in dropped players from coop sessions at odd times (including after a mission is already over), Iron Brigade is an excellent budget title and worth your time, especially if you have some friends to play coop with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198867265354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1699155357}
review: I've played this game since I was young. There's a tiny problem with multiplayer here and there, but I've never had anything too major happen. Just a couple disconnects at the start of a match, which is never really a problem. It constantly adds new enemies and all sorts of fun new weapons and tools at your disposal as you progress through the story, and the art style and the Double Fine charm just makes it all that much more worth it. I love this game so much, please play it with a couple friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039971146', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1175, 'last_played': 1574429211}
review:
Ah, Iron Brigade, or what was originally going to be titled "Trenched" for the obvious reason that you literally man a Mech from a trench based atop of it. This tower defense game definitely sticks out to me. The WW2 style vibes for the Mechs, the different types of Mechs you can use, a wide variety of weapons all with different attributes, for example, the bog standard machine gun, use it on any enemy, but having trouble with aerial units? Slap on a flak gun and smoke them. Prefer to sit back near the objective? Use a special type of leg set to hunker down, giving you a quicker reload and upping your armour defense. There's so much more to the customisation but bare in mind, different Mech types effect what kind of turrets/equipment you can bring with you. The smaller the Mech the more you can bring, think of it like the less weaponry you have on you, the more weaponry you can throw out on the battlefield. The bigger your Mech, the more you can equip therefore giving you less to call in to help. 
When playing with friends, up to 4 players, try to be strategical. Have a good mixture of small and large with a range of different turrets, experiment and see what works best, but be careful, your turrets can be destroyed by the enemy so placing them willy nilly isn't always a good idea.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998197915', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 2004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1994, 'last_played': 1625354082}

author: {'steamid': '76561198075590397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1483295292}
review:
If you have somehow stumbled upon this review, this is one of the best games i have played. its a mech survival + tower defence. don't expect the towers to do all the work for you!! the enemies come in vast, and fast

the mechs and various loadouts in this is really neat. early on you will have limitations and mid game onward you will be running in missions to see what works. 

you know that scene in the 3rd matrix movie where they are fighting off the cybertech alien like creatures in the mechs. THIS IS THAT.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060560157', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1624836109}
review:
Friend got this for me.

EDIT: since people seem to be stupid, the FPS cap can be changed with the resolution option.

This is actually a surprisingly competent game. The tutorial is probably my favorite in any game ever (I hate tutorials, so that's a high bar), and the game gives you a lot of freedom to do things that other games would just baby you over. It's also got some goofy, over-the-top designs but it's self-aware and doesn't take itself too seriously, which is always fun.

It's just a really pleasant game overall, and it's well worth playing with friends. Maybe someone can even make an HD graphics texture pack or mod to really give it the shine it deserves.

Unfortunately, the game doesn't work with ultrawide resolutions and crashes a lot in fullscreen, but honestly playing in windowed is better to begin with for a game like this. It's like OSRS in a way.

4/5; more games need to be this good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971544967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 1175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1175, 'last_played': 1619277344}
review:
A hybrid tower-defense, first person shooter game sort of in the vein of Orcs Must Die.  Gameplay is how you would expect, with a combo of shooting and using towers to defend your base(s) against the enemies.  The setting is quite unusual with it being a weird alternate WW1 setting with mechs and your enemies being the broadcast.  They are these weird cathode ray enemies with names of various parts of TVs and electronics (Knobs, Resistors, etc).  Never really understood what these were supposed to be but the are definitely original.  Your character is a marine piloting a big, cumbersome mech.

The game has some very good elements, but also many very bad or annoying elements.  The best aspect of the game is that your mech is very customizable.  There are different chassis with different weapon slots, tower slots, armor, speed, etc.  There are also different categories of weapons and emplacements and you find and buy new variants as you go.  Many of the weapons have special abilities like piercing or richocet too.  Unlocking and decking out your mech was fun and was easily the best part of the game.  The setting was another positive, very unique.  Unfortunately that is about it for the positives for me.

The negatives are kind of plentiful and really ruined the game for me.  The DLC expansion (included with the game by default) was especially bad.  The biggest problem is that this game is clearly designed as a co-op game, but no one is really doing that anymore so you are mostly stuck with single player unless you have some friends who want to play this old game with you.  Single player is completely doable, but it really isn't that fun.  Towers kind of suck in this game (at least until you get a bunch or upgrade them) and you start with little money so you are largely shooting things yourself until later in the level.  Won't be a problem early in the game but later levels get annoying.  Couple this with your mech being slow and turning weird and many enemies being able to attack your towers and you get a frantic game where you are running (slowly) across the map.  Oh, and you need to pick up the currency (and loot drops) with your character too so more running around.  Just isn't that fun.  Another annoyance is that the cutscenes are not skippable nor are the levels repeatable from in mission.  Want to try a mission again, die/abandon the mission, select the map again, deploy and listen to the same stuff all over again.  You also have to physically move on the ship to select the mission and move to another place to deploy.  The game just has no respect for your time.  Game also has clunky, consol-ish menu's that are more annoying to navigate then they should be (mech customization mainly).  Beyond that, the game also has other bad design choices.  It doesn't tell you what enemies are coming other then some very minor hints in the mission choice screen.  It does give advice on weapons/towers which is a hint too but still you mainly need to wait until they come out or memorize there patterns from previous runs.  It also starts the mission immediately on starting the mission, so you have no time to get your bearings (which is harder on a 3d map in first person).

Anyway, you probably think I hate this game but it is still somewhat fun, at least for the standard game.  I did hate the expansion and ended up quitting on the 3rd level (levels are huge, enemies are harder to kill and it just makes all the annoyances above really stick out).  I just didn't think it was worth the frustration anymore.  I still wouldn't recommend this game though, even for the standard game.  I really like the strategy portion of tower defense games, so this game already is not my favorite style with the shooting added but this game is particularly bad in the strategic part with low tower volumes and no good way to plan ahead.  Orcs Must Die was fun so I can enjoy this style, but this game made too many missteps.  Maybe it's worthwhile with friends but otherwise it is a game most people should skip, there are many better games in the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086128374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 72567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 137, 'playtime_at_review': 2885, 'last_played': 1711197413}
review: Iron Brigade plays similar to Dungeon Defenders, but without the endless grind.  Survival mode's 3 maps are the heart of the end-game.  Once you learn how to solo survival (you need piercing sniper turrets from swamp survival and super shredder machine guns from cathedral map for your first solo completions), the insanity of mastering survival while giving yourself ridiculous handicaps becomes the driving force of playing this game.  I am disappointed there's no weekly leaderboard like there is on the xbox 360 version, but I'm still fascinated with improving my gameplay (like being in position on waves 14-17 really matter).  If the player base were larger, this game would be incredible for co-op, as the difficulty is scaled to the amount of players.  A four-player match is nothing like a solo run....everyone needs to be on their toes and know how to cooperate and communicate.  Overall, the game's art style and the story's writing for the plot were very well done.  If you like shooting stuff and setting up defences then get this game on sale.  I've beaten Swamp and Settlement literally hundreds of times but its still fun figuring out the little tricks of where to build outside the map and/or putting emplacements in places where burst transmitters or knobs won't break them.

Kill enemies to rank up, ranking up earns you better equipment you can use for your, "Trench" a pilotable mech that you and your friends can all control. author: {'steamid': '76561198014072167', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1609386140}
review:
A game where you mostly try to stop waves of enemies from destroying $objective by using your m̶e̶c̶h̶ Mobile Trench and your t̶u̶r̶r̶e̶t̶s̶ Emplacements.  There are a decent variety of enemies to kill, a smattering of Trench pieces to assemble and a good array of guns and Emplacements to use. The number of Trench component "types" is small, around 6 chassis in 3 classes and 4-6 types of legs. Each type gets 4-5 mechanically identical upgrades with maybe a minor tweak on the highest level. Each justifies it's existence so I can't complain that every option is interesting, but you end up with nothing new to see relatively early for a game that touts customization.

Guns are a different story, there are a few weapon types and within each type there is a base set of upgrade guns and a number of named guns with unique mechanics. Guns with bouncing bullets, automatic sniper rifles, sticky grenades and more provide a smorgasbord of options. Emplacements tend to be linear upgrades on one another but the list of options is pretty good and provides several ways to set up your killzone.

Game looks fine if you're not picky about modern graphics, mechanics are mostly alright although chasing scrap(the resource used to deploy Emplacements) can be tedious and buggy. 

Enemy variety is good, they're distinct, have distinct names and each change the situation on the ground when they arrive. 

Some consideration of the teamwork mechanics is warranted given the emphasis on team play. It's nice to work with folks and the even distribution of scrap among players regardless of who picks things up is nice. Assisting one another is easy and you can upgrade one another's Emplacements just like your own. This suggests that  worrying about individual performance is to be avoided, since putting upgrades on a teammate's Emplacements changes them to your color scheme and (I believe) attributes their kills to you. This means the Assault trenches with the heavy guns and big armor can often put the final upgrade on an Emplacement created by an Engineer trench and there by end up credited with more gun kills *and* more turret kills. This wouldn't matter much except that the game shows a performance report after every mission. This makes playing the "unique" option in this game somewhat frustrating as the weaker Trenches just don't feel like they're performing.

Overall the game is great fun, costs relatively little even without a sale and provides a couple evenings of fun for a team at the very least. I like to play games with something new to offer even if they aren't deep and involved. This is a good way to spend a short bit of time and if you don't ask for more than it can offer it's totally worth it,

Highly recommend provided you want to play a goofy defense game with mechs and turrets with your friends in the first place.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969062133', 'num_games_owned': 2104, 'num_reviews': 1248, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1609120769}
review: A combination turret defense/FPS game where you drive a mech around, plop turrets, and fight angry TVs.  It's charming at first but runs into the same issues I have with other attempts at turret defense/RTS combo games - frustrating to strategize turret placement without a top down perspective and clear incoming enemy paths, and on the FPS side you're just endlessly pouring lead into bullet sponge enemies. On top of that, this game really seems to be designed for coop multiplayer, leaving you alone to manage four lanes of incoming enemies from multiple directions Probably fun with pals but alone it felt like a chore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198327764276', 'num_games_owned': 1355, 'num_reviews': 572, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1606598924}
review:
IRON BRIGADE, TE PODES IR BIEN A LA!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Que difícil se hicieron los últimos niveles dios!
Ah si.. reseña.
Una especie de tower defense combinado con un mecha con todo tipo de equipamiento.
El juego tiene un estilo de humor peculiar, tonto, pero bueno.
Duración un poco más de lo promedio.
Mucha acción y mucha frustración. Cuando pasas de nivel y matas a los jefazos das un grito de victoria al estilo dark souls, porque realmente es difícil.
Con este juego aprendí a no estar enojado cuando perdes, ya que algunos niveles llegan a durar 30 minutos y perdí como 3 veces. Hay que ir viendo que arma va para cada enemigo y cada nivel. Es horrible.
Lo jugable es simple, moverse y disparar.
La historia es buena, simple, común y con bigote, si, con bigote.
Los primeros niveles vas a cagarte de risa, pero después vas a llorar.
Ahora el juego en si, no es la gran cosa. Tiene niveles donde vas modificando tu mecha con armas y algunas habilidades.
No es tan conocido el juego, ya que salió para xbox pero no para play station.
Lo recomiendo. Te entretiene y te hace enojar demasiado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172691650', 'num_games_owned': 2475, 'num_reviews': 375, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1601807717}
review:
[b]Iron Brigade[/b] is IMHO very similar to [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/334210/Fortified/]Fortified[/url] in the sense that it's wacky, or at least it tries hard to be (tbh, the humour wears out after a while), and has a TD aspect with well-varied turrets and enemies, in addition to being able to run around shooting at the swarms that will converge on whatever you're trying to protect. However, due to the difference in theme, Iron Brigade has something more special in its arsenal - not only does it let you pilot your own mech, you'll get to customize it as well, which comes in handy when figuring out which chassis and legs to use, which turrets to bring, or which guns to equip... the variety is simply amazing here!  

[h1]Watch me play![/h1]
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8Au4_ocmugU


Besides the typical "defend a structure" from waves of enemies, Iron Brigade will also have you on the offensive at the end of every map where you'll get to battle a big bad "boss". Bosses have different abilities and will, usually, spawn different enemies so you'll really have to be on your toes constantly.

Now, the game seems to be designed around co-op play and perhaps due to this, I find the game to be, at one point (after the Egypt boss), too difficult to continue solo. It is also possible that the previous levels are intended to be "farmed" for "loot" like better turrets and weapons and stuff, making headlong progression (no backtracking) too tall an order for most solo players.

As some reviewers have mentioned, Iron Brigade is a pretty old game and I do notice that the game tend to crash fairly consistently whenever I alt-tabbed out of the game and then tried to bring the game screen back up. I also have a bone to pick with the game for not adding in a "skip cutscene" option, forcing me to rewatch the same cutscene whenever I have to repeat a level [spoiler]due to failing it of course[/spoiler], or that I can't skip the end screen of each level where the score takes quite some time to fully load.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
+ Challenging boss battles where you'll get to go on the offensive
+ Fun TD levels that get increasingly difficult, more so if you're trying to play the game solo 
+ Can play with up to 3 of your friends in co-op
+ Customizable mechs where you can change basically everything from the paint job, to the guns and the chassis.
+ Incredible variety of turrets, weapons and enemies
+ Humorous storyline with wacky characters 

[h1]Cons[/h1]
- Personally, at one point, I don't find the game very solo player-friendly. Best if you can grab a few friends to play the game with you.
- The humour wears out pretty quickly for me. I think younger players might enjoy the humour more though! 
- Some issues with the game crashing without any warning or errors - Don't tab out of the game and you should be fine! 
- Old game so it lacks some features that I value like being able to skip cutscenes that I've seen before.


[h1]Side Note[/h1]
[quote]If you like this review and would like to follow me for more, please feel free to drop by my curator page: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33780629-The-Midcore-Gamer/[/quote]
