author: {'steamid': '76561198006138809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1442043490}
review:
So, got this game from a friend of mine. Unfortunately, my computer is barely capable of running it with quite a bit of lag, and it's very fast-paced, so I can't really give this game the full trying-out it deserves.

However, from what I was capable of playing, the interface was absolute shit, and the controls were a little clunky (a bit of that was from the lag, though, but not that much) both of which seem like they stem from the game being designed for console controlers rather then keyboard and mouse. The actual gameplay, however, was quite fun, though it seems like it takes some getting used to. In particular, the game is very fast paced for a tower defense (the first wave, from the two levels I played not counting the tutorial, seems to always spawn immediately or nearly immediately upon starting the level, and there was very little time to gain your bearings between waves. I don't know how much of this was lag, however) added a nice, hectic pacing that really drew me in, though was not very conducive to strategic planning. It would probably be easier with multiple people, with at least one shooting and one planting turrets, and it did kinda seem like the game was really pushing me towards playing with multiple people, which can be a good or bad thing depending on how many friends you have. A minimap also wouldn't have been misplaced in this game, and seems like an odd omission that I found myself instinctively looking for.

Overall, it's a fun second-person shoot-em-up game with some tower defense aspects thrown in. I would say it's worth the $15 if you like those kinda games. Especially if it's on sale, or if you have friends to play with.

EDIT: Oh, and I forgot to mention; Unskippable cut-scenes warning. There's a lot of them. Big no-no, Double Fine...

author: {'steamid': '76561197989390503', 'num_games_owned': 617, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1443469279}
review:
A fun tower defence game. Customize your mech (known as trench) and go out into the field to defend the objective. Iron Brigade combines the 3rd person shooter combat with the classic tower defence gameplay of strategically placing turrets of various kinds to help you make a stand.

There is a large variety of enemies, which are introduced bit by bit throughout the campaign, ranging from fast fliers to slow yet durable Big Willies, to suicidal Blitzers, and hordes of spiky balls known as the Knobs. Each enemy has its own strengths and weaknesses and therefore you are required to outfit your trench with optimum weaponry for each mission in order to be effective. Most of the enemy designs were pretty creative and had a sort of personality.

I've played throughout the whole game solo. The early missions are fairly easy, but latter ones do pose a substantial challenge and might require several tries to get your strategy up to perfection. It's fun if you like a challenge. The game also has a handful of boss fights, so to speak. They do feel kind of different and out of touch with the rest of the gameplay though, especially the final boss of the original campaign.

There were some small annoyances, like there being too little time in between the waves and cutscenes/dialogue not being skippable (not that I've found anyway), but other than this, it was fine.

I didn't realise there was also an expansion act to the game, called 'Rise of the Martian Bear'. After playing the first mission, I'm a bit disappointed with it. It seems co-op play is encouraged much more here than solo play (so I might have to try them out on co-op), not to mention a strange lag that wasn't present in any of the previous missions. You also get some survival missions where you fight an endless horde of enemies.

Overall it's a fun game. It has a nice sense of humour to it with a hint of silliness, but it certainly works and can often give you a good chuckle. So if you like tower defence games, you should find Iron Brigade worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036871264', 'num_games_owned': 1025, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1440957858}

author: {'steamid': '76561198088229804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 979, 'last_played': 1608400398}
review:
Ist ein gutes Action-Towerdefense-Spiel.

Pros:
- Interessantes Setting mit Mechs und mechanischen Monstern
- Mechs sind in Klassen aufgeteilt, die sich in Waffenanzahl, Geschwindigkeit und Kosten für Türme unterscheiden: Ingenieur, Standard und Kampf
- Mechs sind indivdualisierbar: Chassis, Waffen, Türme
- Vielzahl von Waffen
- Online Multiplayer (theoretisch)

Cons:
- Spätere Karten klar auf Multiplayer ausgelegt (Karten zu groß und Mechs zu langsam)
- Nichts los im Online-Multiplayer
- Lokaler Multiplayer fehlt, hätte sich gut angeboten (wie bei vielen Spielen)
-> spätere Karten unnötig schwer

Empfehlenswert für Spieler die Sanctum, Orcs must die oder auch Dungeon Defender (nur online Multiplayer) mögen, allerdings ohne lokalen Multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133198333', 'num_games_owned': 1978, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1425090146}
review:
Жанр "Защита башни", одно время ставший настолько популярным, что каждый школьних начал клепать одноклеточные игры, неотличимые друг от друга и сюжетом не обремененные, изжил себя достаточно быстро. И когда, казалось бы, разбавить его стало нечем... внезапНА появились шикарные Orcs Must Die, смешавшие задорный экшон, чуть-чуть рпг элементов и защиту башни.
И как жаль, что игр вроде Orcs Must Die крайне мало.
Однако, есть. И одна из таких Iron Brigade.

И ты меня спросишь, дорогой читатель, мол "А причем тут орки, замки и маги вот к этому про роботов и вундервафли?", и, быть может, даже усомнишься в моей адекватности. Но нет, связь она есть:

1) Помимо тупой защиты базы и построек башенок, тут есть экшон с видом от третьего лица.
2) Да, тут надо стрелять, а не махать заточкой.
3) Магии нет, есть технологии... но, какая разница?
4) В обеих играх есть сюжет.

Ах да, точно, сюжет. Услышав некий "Сигнал" из космоса, люди умирали сразу, но двое-таки выжило и стали гениями инженерами изобретателями. Один из них малость сошел с ума и изобрел что-то вроде телевиденья и хотел с его помощью убить мозги людям (тонко, да?), и его "телемонстры" угроза всей земле. Но второй выживший гений - бравый американский генерал, всех спасет. 

Советую поиграть, а вот на счет купить думайте сами ^_^

Конец.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998118312', 'num_games_owned': 2100, 'num_reviews': 388, 'playtime_forever': 1112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1081, 'last_played': 1437614091}
review:
8/10
Overview: Third Person Tower Defense 


The Good:

+ The main feature of the game is that you can customize a mech in a variety of different ways. First you choose the chassis which allows you to carry more weapons or tower placements (but not both) . Then you choose the type of weapons you want to use: machine guns, shotguns, sniper rifles etc. More powerful guns require more weapon slots. Then you choose the type of towers you want. Different maps require different load outs. Experimenting with different weapons and towers is part of the fun.  

+ Plenty of weapons and towers that can be bought or found 

+ Lots of enemies that require you to change up your tactics, some enemies target your towers, other target you etc. 

+ Killing enemies and completing levels allows you to level up allowing you to use more powerful weapons and towers

+ Good voice acting

+ Full controller support

+Coop

+Removed GWFL


The Average:


Maps that require only one area to defend can feel repetitive because the basic strategy never really changes.   

Big difficulty spike in the last few maps 


The Bad:

- multiplayer/coop is dead and thus completing certain achievements will be hard

Conclusion:

A fun if not short tower defense game that focuses more on third person shooting than actual tower placement. A fun diversion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039485065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1474895166}
review:
It's a mix of the popular tower defence genre and Fisher Price's Armored Core - and somehow, it works. It really works. 
A budget title, and yet it's one of the most solid and enjoyable things I've played in years. A seriously excellent and gleefully imaginative third person shooter that I haven't seen the like of since Planet Moon's days. 

Only got a few criticisms really - a way to save custom loadouts for your Trench (what they call the mechs) would be appreciated. Because switching between my Selker Mk 1 and the Karlsson is a little annoying - though attaching the guns is always pretty satisfying (props to whoever was in charge of sound design). Though on the same note, I probably don't need the character barking every couple minutes about how my machinegun's "shred" ability gets me more scrap (in-mission currency) off enemies - thanks.
Oh, and no playable Coach Oleander? Seriously? 

Anyway, play it. Solo or co-op or whatever. This is REAL good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999935168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1188, 'playtime_forever': 1324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1324, 'last_played': 1436132204}
review: As of July, 2015, I guess that since GFWL has been removed the scrap stutter bug is gone. I haven't played enough to see if it has and I probably am not going to but I trust other users saying that it has. Even so, my vote still stays at a downvote for two reasons: 1. It is still 30fps capped and 2. It took years for this game breaking bug to be fixed. They blew their chance to have a good game upon release years ago and never fixed it so they get no sympathy from me no matter what their reason is. The game was broke on release and failed and nothing can undo that. Is the game worth buying now? Only if you like games in slow motion at 30 fps. It is a very good game that was broken and forgotten. Now that the scrap bug is supposedly gone, catch this on sale for a fun time. In slow motion.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988113155', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1435886895}
review: Played the hell out of this on the 360, now I'm playing it again thanks to recent updates making the game actually playable on the pc. Mix 3rd person shooter with tower defense, add unlockables & upgrades and level progression and you have this gem! IB is humerous with an unique story and atmosphere, I think damn near everyone who likes 3rd person shooters and TDs needs to try Iron Brigade! See you on the battlefield soldier!

author: {'steamid': '76561198003213131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 591, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1435259397}
review:
Bon, iron brigade, le jeu est sympa, MAIS, je ne vous le recommande pas plein pot, prenez le en promo :p

Dans le style tower defense/TPS, le jeu se pose là. Ce jeu m'a pas mal rappelé un autre du même genre qui avait de plus jolis graphisme, de meilleurs effets sonore et qui prenait plus le parti du tower que du TPS et ce jeu est ... ah zappé le nom ... bon je vais chercher ça ... évidemment c'était à la fin de ma liste ... donc Sanctum qui est mieux en tout point à mon goût. Là iron brigade est pas mal, mais très très brouillon.

Il n'y a pas de vue tactique, superrrr pratique pour poser des tourelles ou des champs de mines, souvent je passe les premier instant à voir par où arrive vraiment les ennemis avant de poser mes premiers modules histoires qu'ils soient bien placés car même la map de briefing est pas top ...

Bon sinon on peut dire quelque chose de positif c'est que la personalisation et le loot sont vraiment important dans le jeu. C'est un point positif alors soulignons-le. En effet il sera bien difficile pour quelqu'un ne jurant que par le bourrinage pur et dur de terminer une map sans poser un seul module, se sera moins casse tête c'est sur car du coup le scrap metal des ennemis ne sert à rien et donc plus besoin de se précipiter dessus, mais ça complexifie énormément les choses quand on doit défendre des objectifs, soit 95% du jeu. Les seuls moments où l'on passe en full bourrin c'est pour les boss, c'est tout.

Il est vraiment dommage que les tourelles ne puissent pas être posées via une vue tactique et que l'on est obligation de déplacer son mecha jusque là où l'on souhaite en voir une, c'est complètement stupide puisque ce n'est pas notre mecha qui construit la tourelle mais juste qui demande un déploiement dans une zone. S'ils avaient un peu plus copier sur le voisin j'aurai vraiment donner une meilleure recommandation car le jeu aurait gagné en clarté et en lisibilité sur le champs de bataille, mais non, ils ont voulu faire à leur sauce et finalement ça ne prend pas.

Donc je vous le recommande, à petit prix, à petite dose et surtout à jouer entre amis en coop afin d'y trouver un peu de fun car en solo c'est ennuyant au possible.

review: A surprisingly fun game.  A buddy of mine and I gold starred the campaign in one 9-hour play session.  Movement is a bit wonky.  Downfalls include: limited shop, inability to sell turrets, the way the game creates lobbies, and no drop-in drop-out multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963225974', 'num_games_owned': 2359, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 1662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1359, 'last_played': 1445011823}
review:
This game checked so many of my boxes it was kind of a guaranteed sale. It spans many of my favorite genres, has plenty of content, co-op! I will just list things :)

[b]Why this compelled me[/b]
* Tower-defense, more so when playing single
* Shooter, more so when playing multiplayer
* Mech-game with customization; weapons, chassi, legs, towers, paintjob
* Character progression, challenges, achievements, all doable without much grind outside of completing the game.
* Customizable player character, only cosmetic, but fun when running around in the lobby before starting a multiplayer game.

[b]What impressed me[/b]
* The multiplayer lobby is the same as single player, other people just loads up in the empty slots on your ship. It's great design really, and you can look at other people's mechs and gesture at their characters :)
* Anyone you have invited to a multiplayer game ends up in your regiment, which has separate challenges to complete, it just happens automatically and it's kind of great :o
* All customization on your mech and character are visible immediately in game, has custom animations and models, so nice :3

[b]What I found interesting[/b]
* Many of your towers can actually be killed, and they are not at all used to build labyrinths, you cannot block enemies with towers. It's just different :)
* The whole game design seems built around quirky humor, at first it's quite odd but after a while I just ran with it. Game mechanics sold me on the experience.

[b]What I missed/issues[/b]
* An overhead map, on some symmetrical levels it can be really tricky to know where you've placed towers, makes for quite a bit of running around. It does make sense though as the player characters probably do not have any radar och satellite to provide map data.
* In the shop I would love to see if I actually own an item already, especially the cosmetics for the marine, it's a minor gripe but it felt like an obvious feature.
* Playing during a summer sale makes Steam a bit glitchy, several times one or several were disconnected from Steam during multiplayer which boots them from the game. Sadly you cannot rejoin, this was kind of annoying in Survival which can take 1-2 hours depending on your success. There were no issues while the USA was asleep though.
* Some maps have places where you can get stuck, and you cannot jump or even walk over very low  walls, this is pretty annoying when it happens. But then I always try to get to places I'm not supposed to go :x
* I took me a while to realize why this felt exactly like playing on a console, I think the game is locked to 30 fps, which is kind of a bummer when using a 120Hz monitor.

All in all I was very impressed by this game, I was looking for another tower defense game, saw this in a short clip on YouTube, and kept an eye out during a summer sale. Played it for an entire weekend with my brothers and a friend, great times was had :P

author: {'steamid': '76561198120058773', 'num_games_owned': 1708, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 1294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1235, 'last_played': 1635433834}
review:
"Unrefined Gem" is what this tittle is.

(the game has recently moved from GFWL to Steam, good move, but resulting in a hic-cup, nothing major though. dev promises a patch for it already)

[h1]The Positive:[/h1]
+ cartoonish steampunk graphic style makes it looks nice for its age
+ visual during firefights is satisfying
+ loadouts offer different playstyle
+ balanced between player and tower loadouts
+ player progression is a plus, something to work for
+ 4 players co-op
+ gameplay is entertaining, more in co-op play
+ removed GFWL

[h1]The Between:[/h1]
+/- shop and credit system
+/- game difficulty gears toward casual style hybrid TD
+/- good, but annoying player response during gameplay

[h1]The Negative:[/h1]
- too short, lack of survival mode for each story mission.
- difficulty scaling is too easy in co-op missions with experienced TD players.
- the half-baked loadouts management kills the purpose of shop and credit system
- not bad, but clunky interfaces here and there, could use improvement

If you got friends to play with, this is a gem for you

author: {'steamid': '76561197971867956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1157, 'last_played': 1555013246}
review:
Surprisingly Addictive...
The Mixture of Tower Defense and Gunning a Mech is just great. And its even implemented very well.
If u want Fire Power on your Mech, u got to sacrifice heavy Turrets and the other way round.
Speaking of which, I think there could be even more Chassis with different Turret loadouts and Weapons.
Cant actually remember which combination it was i wished for during Playtime, but well, you might encounter the very same wish during playthrough. So lets say its a feature of the game, since u have to adapt to the possible choices and loadouts to figure out a good strategy to beat the later (and harder) maps.

Unfortunately u will have to do quite some grinding now and then for leveling and upgrades, but it also offers ways to experiment different approaches on same maps.

Anyhow, I bought this game when it was very cheap a few weeks ago b4 summer sale. Even for 5 bucks its still a great bargain

author: {'steamid': '76561198041150422', 'num_games_owned': 567, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1434335177}
review:
Since I'm finally able to play it since they removed the MSN login, I can finally play it.  That's the good news.

The bad news is it's a mediocre.  This third-person tower defense, similar to Orcs Must Die.  Not all items can be purchased in the store and can be obtained from loot boxes that drop from the larger monsters.  Good customization with chassis, legs, weapons, and costume options with some of the setups looking like HERCs from Starsiege, but gameplay is what brings it down, along with the humor falling flat in several areas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023687979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 1662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1110, 'last_played': 1558649896}
review:
I can't recommend Iron Brigade, though I wish I could.

This is a nice mix of 3rd person mech-fighting misxed with tower defense. The maps are adequate and the weapons are a lot of fun... but multiplayer is broken, which takes away this game's most promising feature: multiplayer coop. Also, the online community seems to be very small.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014986582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1621, 'last_played': 1511435230}
review: Look its a fun game, and all.  I am thumbs up... TILL you get to multiplayer.   Thats what kills it.  You and your buddies are playing.  One hint of lag, latency, frame drops, and boom: You lost that member of the team.   You add a thrid player: GAME COMPLETELY Crashes.    And there are levels where you need more then one or two people to complete.   SO untill this game is updated to handle lag better, and extra players... Its a full thumbs down.

review: Nice game, and found it mildly addictive, however i have been contiounisly running into controller bugs that are making it unplayable. author: {'steamid': '76561198034849256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1556, 'last_played': 1434393435}
review:
Iron Brigade - эта шутер от третьего лица с элементами тауэр дефенс. Действие происходит в альтернативной истории в сеттинге дизельпанк, где оказывать противодействие злодею и его армии, по среди всеобщего упадка, нужно будет используя шагающие механические сооружения - мобильные траншеи, которые с некоторыми допущениями можно назвать роботами, а роботов я люблю!

Собственно о геймплее, здесь он динамичный и сбалансированный, но сразу вызывает недоумение отсутствие уровней сложности или же я их в упор не заметил. Робот в игре всего один - тот, который вы сами скомпонуете из предоставленных модулей корпуса, вооружения и сооружений-башен, все-таки это тауэр дефенс, все детали открываются по мере прохождения игры, получения новых уровней и имеются в действительно обильном количестве. 
Определенных рамок в процессе создания робота нет, есть только предпосылки к выбору отдельных частей, в зависимости от миссии и набора противников (их здесь то же не мало видов!), но соблюдение этих рамок далеко не обязательно, как принято говорить: "Что хотите, то и творите".

Помимо, на мой взгляд, достаточно продолжительной сюжетной компании здесь есть миссии на выживание, где можно получить уникальные детали. Учитывая кооперативную направленность игры, так же в наличие различные средства индивидуализации, такие как краска для робота, предметы одежды для солдата и жесты, всего этого то же достаточно. Если говорить о графике, она консольная, все в меру детализированно и роботы и локации и визуальные эффекты, но без излишеств и некстгена. 

В заключении не большое замечание о коопе, на момент написания обзора я играл в него три раза и заметные лаги были только в первый раз, когда стояли самые высокие настройки графики, в последующие разы я убрал тени и лаги практически исчезли.

7,6 из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024529671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1923, 'last_played': 1449938585}
review:
[h1]General Overview:[/h1]

Essentially a tower defense game, but not so much in the sense "you" may think. You control a walking WWII mecha with a variety of WWII and retro-like futuristic fantasy (WWII imagination) weaponry assortments ranging from machine guns, to sniper rifles, to futuristic "radar" like microwave guns and more. Towers to an extent are important, but this game focuses more on what YOU must do as the player/mecha, which you control. The main damage you do, is from the mecha and the assortments of weapons that you attach on it. As turrets are generally piss poor at dealing damage, and if you choose to ONLY use turrets, it can only carry you through the first level. As with later levels, it becomes more and more challenging, making you, the mecha/player and your strategy and weaponry, your involvement first hand more important. 

[h1]Pros:[/h1]

- Mecha WWII machines of war

- A lot of customization options

- Really fun grinding for rare items and customizable clothes, weapons and paint jobs

- Stupidly easy to play

- Learning curve is on the softer side

- Beefs up and becomes harder appropriately near the end 

- Co-op

- Replay value is good

- Amazing graphics, the main advertisement screenshots do not do it justice

- Got the hang of the game in about 4 missions (learned how to play that is)

[h1]Cons:[/h1]

- Tutorial for me at least, threw me off a little

- Wish they had more missions

- About 4 different campaigns, with 4 to 6 missions in each

- Co-op can get a little laggy at times

- Replay value is cut short after you acquire all rare items and complete all missions and survival missions on gold

- Wish they had even “more” weapons

[h1]Conclusion:[/h1]

I am simply aghast, amazed that this game isn't more popular. The graphics are great, the missions are fun, replay value is huge (especially co-op) and the price is cheap and out of this world. The ONLY reason this game doesn't have a lot more popularity and was put into the gutter and I did some research into this. Is, as I saw some other reviewers comment about this, and I did not understand what they were talking about. So bear with me quickly. Is because, the game was licensed to only be played/playable on and through the Microsoft Gaming Platform Program, the equivalent of Steam. Apparently playing the game through the Microsoft Gaming Platform really made the game laggy, crashed, and near impossible to play when it was streamed through the Microsoft Game Platform Software. The game owners then switched their accessibility to Steam and everything is all o'kay now. 

P.S.: (If you didn't understand, let me make this clear, yes, you can play this on Microsoft computers just fine, it is referring to Microsoft's attempt at making and implementing an online gaming platform equivalent to Steam and they failed horribly at it, which the above mentioned is about.) (The game runs fine.)

All in all, I am surprised I didn't find out about this MUCH game sooner, give it a chance, and I can promise you, you will be throughly impressed and satisfied. (Mobile Trench Brigade over and out!)

I would definitely recommend and encourage this game to friend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073949629', 'num_games_owned': 542, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1406, 'last_played': 1433840148}
review:
I originally had a negative review for this game, but that was when this was run by GFWL. What you have here is a game that is good when played solo, and fantastic when played with friends. It has a short campaign but a tremendous replay value. I don't have many hours on it on PC< but on xbox 360 I had about 100+ hours into it. The graphics aren't that bad, the humor is dry but funny, and you can spend 10 minutes running after your friends on the ship in between missions making weird gestures at them.

It does have an endless mode with at least 3 maps. Overall this is a fantastic buy and there are not many games like it. The only ones I have played that are similar is Sanctum and Orcs Must Die and this game blows them away. It has Tower Defense, Mech warfare, and even customization. Want to wear a gas mask and flack jacket and charge in with a mech decked out in jungle camo? Go for it. Want to buy a tux and a top hat and charge in with a mech made of gold, platnium, and silver, by all means good chum have at it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009300888', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1325, 'last_played': 1520941351}
review:
良い所
・GfWLが無くなった。だからかどうかは知らないがSteam実績がちゃんと解除される。
・レベルアップしていくおっさん

author: {'steamid': '76561198026599865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2277, 'last_played': 1433736297}
review:
Iron Brigade is a very fun game no matter if you are to play it in solo or co-op mode. 
It is even better if you have friends to play it with so you guys can communicate via mic. 
If you like tower defense game, you find might this game entertaining. 
There are quite a lot of weapons for you to unlock/find in this game; you can also equip different mechs depending on the maps you're going to play.
Dont let the stream pictures fool you, the in-game graphics are actually pretty nice. 
As of the moment I am writing this review, they dont have GFWL anymore and I experience no lag or connection issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966789126', 'num_games_owned': 1246, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1433128286}
review:
I've lost count of the number of times Iron Brigade has soft-locked my rig today. This a great game, full of all the aspects we all expect from a Double Fine title. But this port fails technically. Audio bugs, graphical stutter, and the dreaded full-system crash abound. Matchmaking is miserable. Even if you do get a game going, you're almost guaranteed to crash out of the client at the end of the round screen. Removing GFWL was not the magic bullet the community expected. Don't be sold on the hype. This game is still very broken.

If this gets patched, I'll update my review. PC Master Race, you're better off picking this title up on console.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992722585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1418, 'last_played': 1453007379}
review:
Its a great game and really fun! But the Co-op connection issues really take the fun out of being able to play with friends. 2 players is a little unstable, it'll stutter then either crash one player or the game splits like someone left but both players are still playing on their computer solo. 3+ just outright crashes. And some missions are a bit hard by yourself in the later stages unless you do some farming and leveling.

Thumbs down currently do the poor co-op connection.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992669178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1433116303}
review: I really want to like this game but for a tower defense they left out some no brainer stuff. No warning about whats coming in the next wave, cant sell towers back if you place something wrong by accident, drops connections in coop constantly. I think Sanctum 2 is way better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028769484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3756, 'last_played': 1534337537}
review:
"トレンチ"という歩く塹壕ロボットに乗ってタレットの設置を行いながら拠点を守るコメディタッチの三人称視点のタワーディフィンスゲームです。

[良い点]
・完全日本語字幕(パーツの説明なども面白く書いてある)
・4人coop対応
・タレットだけではなくプレイヤーも"トレンチ"に乗って戦闘に参加できる
・タレットのみクリアも可能
・トレンチのカスタマイズパーツが豊富(大きい種類としてはトレンチ本体、足パーツ、色、武器、使用タレット、搭乗員の服、搭乗員の帽子)
・順当に難しくなっていくレベルデザイン
・MAP構成や特徴的な敵キャラ(見落としがちなmap構成やバリアーを張る敵などの多様な敵)
・タレットが自由な場所に置ける(オブジェクトの上など)
・アップデートでsteamマッチングに対応した
・やり応えのあるサバイバルモード(50waveまでクリア報酬ありで最大100waveまで)
[悪い点]
・人が少ない(steamマッチングに対応して多少マシにはなったが)
・クラッシュや永久ローディングなどのバグがまだある
・人によってはキャンペーン序盤が簡単すぎて退屈

良いmap構成のせいもあり自分が見落としてた進行ルートを味方がカバーしてくれたり協力プレイが楽しいです。ただsteamマッチングに対応したのも最近のため人が少なくマッチングが地域制限かかってるぽい(これは予想ですが)ので日本以外にはつながらない様子。セールで激安なのでフレンドとやるか持ってる人とフレンドになろう。1人だと人によっては飽きてしまうかも。ただ、ネタ的なもの含め色々なパーツや武器を組み合わせて試したりするのが好きな人やタレットのみクリアとかチャレンジできる人は楽しめるはず。
　初期のsteamマッチング未対応やバグの残念さからか賛否両論な感じですがsteamマッチング対応と少し時間がたつと激重になるバグが直った今セールで買えば値段以上は楽しめるはず。

author: {'steamid': '76561197994723175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1699942931}
review: It's ok

author: {'steamid': '76561197961529342', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3166, 'last_played': 1433856875}
review:
This is a fantastic game. Gameplay is fun, the writing is funny and the style is fantastic. All that combined it is a charming game to play.

Though despite the removal of GFWL and the move to Steamworks, there are still a lot of issues with matchmaking. The stutter bug still exists unfortunately, despite many saying it has been fixed. Though it is nowhere near as bad as it was back on GFWL. But since TakeTwo now have IP rights, we should see some patches and fixes.

Should you get this game despite the bugs? Definitely. It's 80% off and the developers have acknowledged fixes are on the way. So it will only get better (Also maybe more DLCs are on the horizon? ;D)

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198031627363', 'num_games_owned': 1710, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2644, 'last_played': 1674783808}
review:
1 month ago, I would have said this was an absolute waste of money because of GFWL. 

But, thankfully, Double Fine has regained the rights to Iron Brigade and it is again one of the best games out there. 
The mix of Tower Defense and 3rd Person Shooter based in an alternative gritty world is an amazing genre choice.

I played this on XBLA and loved the experience. I'm playing this again on Steam and love it. Must Buy. Great Game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198194508178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1433017455}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035368463', 'num_games_owned': 2141, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1644972773}
review:
This is one heck of a really fun hybrid of third person shooter and tower defense game.
With its alternate world setting that has you going up against the evil Monovisions created by the mad scientist Vlad with bipedal robotic walkers called Trenches, it is quite a interesting and also silly premise.
The Trenches as well as your player character can be customized to an extent, your soldier can have a new piece of headgear and clothing while the Trench itself can get new legs and chassis that each provide different strengths and weaknesses, some Trench chassis don't have many spots for the emplacements you can call in during the missions as well as the guns, so you gotta think carefully about what type of chassis you want.
And now you really have no reason to skip this game as it has finally gotten free from the chains of Games For Windows Live and now uses Steamworks instead for the multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978206623', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1446946755}
review:
I have been looking at this game for awhile and broke down when it was on sale. I am dissapointed in myself that i did not buy this sooner. As a dad that works full time with a young kid I still some how found 5 hours to play this on day one. 

The gameplay is solid. The controls do not feel off and work very well. My normal gripe with mech games is that the sounds are... weak. This one pulls through and the sounds feel like they carry the correct umph for what your are shooting. At first the customization seemed small but opens up very quickly. The mech consists of 2 pieces and each can come with its own special bonus and number of weapon slots.... Im rambling.. This game is worth it and only gets better with the addition of steam multiplayer. 

Id buy that for a dollar

author: {'steamid': '76561198135397513', 'num_games_owned': 430, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2217, 'last_played': 1669442299}
review:
I just love how quickly the review scores skyrocketed once GFWL was removed. I played with two friends last night who'd never played this game before, and before we knew it, it was 5 a.m. This game is definitely worth the price at $14, but $2.99? Why isn't it already in your Steam library?

EDIT: Some people are having issues with the game. I'd like everyone to keep in mind the fact that this is the first time in three years Double Fine have been able to update this game. There are going to be issues. Instead of complaining about them in the review section, why not go and report a bug? Personally, I had no issues running this game. I have a 2GB Nvidia 760 and an Intel 4771 processor, and am running on a 4:3 monitor. If that helps.

review:

the game IS fun but as of now there are a few problems:
- voicechat is always active, no option to deactivate it ingame

author: {'steamid': '76561197993435255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1445, 'last_played': 1449446109}
review:
The best way to describe it is a hybrid of shooter and tower defense. Third person, unlike some others, and in its own way both more and less customization. There are not really defined classes with optimized weapons, however there are different trench chassis, legs, and weapons, each with their own more or less ideal combinations, however you are rarely locked out of a weapon class. You might be unable to carry certain emplacements or weapons on chassis due to size limits or carry limits, but almost every weapon class and emplacement class works on every chassis in combinations. You won't get the biggest guns and five of the strongest emplacements on one chassis, but you aren't truly locked out of something entirely. The weapons handle well, the missions are fairly well made, the survival modes are fun. The game is actually made a lot easier and a lot more fun played co-op.
The only downsides I can think of is that a lot of the cutscenes are unskippable, which does get annoying; and there are a few items you get as rewards for completing something, such as gaining a level or completing a mini mission thing that you can't get back if you sell it. Rewards for completing a story mission can be had by doing it again, but the extra bonus rewards are lost for good if you accidentally sell one.
It's similar enough to Dungeon Defenders and Sanctum to draw comparisons in how it works; you defend against waves of enemies and build defense towers while also shooting them, and yet it's different enough to be worth having if you enjoy this style of game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101743239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1050, 'last_played': 1433488084}
review:
I must say I love this game, I played it on Xbox 360 with my console friends and now I'm here again playing it with my PC friends. I would have liked to see a little bit better of a port, but the gameplay is still good.

In missions I get 60fps it's just in the lobby I get 30fps, not terrible, but this is PC, we need 60fps all around. 

That is probably my biggest complaint. I wish there were more Options to mess with though. Not being able to disable the Voice Coms is kind of annoying, but I edited the game file and got it muted, so its ok.

I would LOVE to see a part 2.

With some optimization and more weapons/legendaries and stuff, and add some random stats drop mechanics maybe with some added effects and damage types. Who knows what else.

Anyways.

Great Game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970329288', 'num_games_owned': 2783, 'num_reviews': 1449, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1467534095}
review:
> May 27th 2015 - Games For Windows Live REMOVED! <

This was one of my favourite games on Xbox LIVE.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OtrfCcbI5U

I couldn't resist getting this game as soon as I saw it on Steam. Iron Brigade is a brilliant first person tower defense game. Plus as a BONUS it's been made by the guys who brought us the amazing 'Psychonauts' - Highly Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990022916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 2307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1629, 'last_played': 1464406437}
review:
The game NO LONGER HAS GFWL and that is a huge deal!

Iron Brigade is an immensely fun hybrid of 3rd-person Mech combat and Tower Defense, filled with lots of weapons, mech parts, and turret types to collect, to support different strategies and play-styles.

It's a gorgeous-looking game as well, and the animation work on all of the weapons and mechanical parts of the mobile trenches is so good, you may just find yourself activating your leg mechanisms and needlessly reloading your weapons, just to watch!  I know I did, many times.

Really the only negative I can think of (now that GFWL is gone)  is that the game itself is really short, IF you consider that a negative.  Me? I like a game that doesn't cost much and gives me a dozen or so hours of high-octane enjoyment; none of my time felt wasted, I left satisfied, and got to move on to other games.  I'll probably play it again, though, when more of my friends pick it up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198061278278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1505522164}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029390738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1558338754}
review:
Ignore the steam hours, I had this on 360 when it was first released to XBLA. This game is incredible. It's a TPS, coop Tower defense mech game that is an absolute blast to play. There's a lot of customization options, lots of enemies, lots of towers, lots of fun. If you're looking for a gem for a friend or 3 to play with, definitely pick this one up. 

[b]Most of the negative reviews are because of GFWL (Games for Windows Live), which has since been removed and replaced with steamworks. The main negative now is it's a bit buggy and has a 30FPS cap in some areas, but I say it's still worth it [/b]

Pros
- Lots of weapons
- Lots of customization
- Lots of enemies and bosses
- Level/Exp system
- Very enjoyable
- Coop
- Removed GWFL
- Full controller support

Cons
- 30 FPS lock at base
- Some bugs
- Can't play more than 2 player coop - WOO THEY APPARENTLY FIXED IT
- Coop can stutter quite bad - WOO THEY APPARENTLY FIXED IT HAVE YET TO TRY IT

author: {'steamid': '76561198026415118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1432697974}
review:
This is a very fun game. Pros: Well designed gameplay, unique enemy designs, easy to jump into and try different mech loadouts. Each level will favor certain weapons, but you aren't punished for experimenting. 

Cons: May be dead online so BYO friends. I havent noticed any stuttering that people have reported in other reviews, but I havent been able to play online yet so maybe that's why. I've been playing with maxed settings with a GTX 970 with game installed to an SSD and everything runs super smooth so far. Even with all the mech loudout variety, eventually the replay value will drop without a stronger online community. Also GFWL (Games for Windows Live) is required to play. Doesnt matter to me much, but I know others will mind. 

Tip: Buy this as a pack with other double fine games to take the sting out of buying this alone and getting stiffed on the dead online community.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000154494', 'num_games_owned': 472, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 955, 'last_played': 1432684534}
review:
EDIT: They updated the game after "just" 3 years from last update. Looks like they lost the rights to publish the game in this time XD and now they regained those rights, and patched game adding steam matchmaking. So the games for windows live problem seems to have been fixed.

After playing it again, the changes are all positive:

-2x and 4x supersampling option added when launching game! resulting into a still very nice looking game
-its now a normal game, no game for windows live logins and problems.
-matchmaking through steamworks seems to work fine
-the stutter that happened when collecting scratch (game resource to build) seems to have also gone!

So overall now I do really recommend this game, im myself gonna play it from the begin again!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970283951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1889, 'last_played': 1450814185}
review:
Tower-defense with giant, upgradeable WW1-era mechs with a colorful cast of characters and a pulp flavored story filled with tons of alien weirdness. Best played with co-op. 

This game can be so much fun. I mean, you have loot in the form of equipment that you can customize your chosen mech with. You can pick different types of frames, treads, and other gadgets like a "scrap magnet" to make gathering the game's currency that much easier and grind missions by repeating them to buy even crazier weapons when they become available. 

You can lay down anti-aircraft guns, turrets, wield railguns, missile launchers, giant shotguns...there's lots of great action in this across plenty of maps. You can also unlock costumes for your pilot, extending its replayability if the weapon drops aren't enough. Want to wear a top hat while riding your mech into battle? Go on and do it then, good sir. The battle will wait for you. Overall, it's kind of like a mech-version of Crimson Skies (the PC version). Just with tower defense features.

Two reasons dogged my experience in playing this -- one is the scrap lag which is already well documented in the forums and other reviews by other users. Essentially, the longer you play the game, the more unstable it gets before it just becomes unplayable and you just have to force it closed. I can't count how many times that spoiled co-op with my friends, having to exit the game and then come back, sometimes more than a few times. Argh.

Two is its reliance on Windows Live. If you don't have the client, you'll need to install it. Apparently there was a plan to eventually remove it by Double Fine, but their hands were tied by Microsoft and that's apparently where the initiative died. The game is all but abandoned at this point.

It's pretty much why I'm sad in giving it a very marginal thumbs down. If it weren't for these two issues, I'd wholeheartedly build an army of steam powered mechs to preach this game to the masses because if you can live with a buggy game that will never be updated, there's some awesome fun tucked away behind these problems.

It's a bit like recommending milk that has turned into cheese in your referigerator. I guess it's edible, and if you strain enough of the cheese out, you might be able to enjoy your Fruit Loops just fine with what's left. Just be ready for when your stomach disagrees with you later. But wow. Those Fruit Loops sure were tasty.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964377789', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 9813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6846, 'last_played': 1502972237}
review:
Un trés bon jeux selon moi : un beau style graphique, une belle ambiance et de bonne idées

Le jeux se deroule comme un tower defense : les ennemis apparaise a des point defini et ce dirige vers la base qu'on est censé defendre, different ennemis avec differentes particuliaritées qui doivent etre combattu avec vos modules, ces module (les tourelles quoi) sont variée et permettent un melange qui convient a nos preferences. Les tranchée mobile que pilote votre personne ne se limite pas a poser des tourelles car elles embarquent aussi varitée d'armes, 6 chassis repartit en  3 categorie sont a disposition : les chassis leger ne peuvent porter que peux d'arme mais peuvent utiliser 4 module et a prix reduit en composant , les chassis moyen sont equilibrer dans la quantitée d'arme et de module et les chassis lourd peuvent porter plein d'arme mais seulement 2 module et pour un prix plus elever. En fontion de la mission vous pouvez changer votre chassis ,jambe ,armes et modules pour etre le plus efficace possible. Vous pouvez trouver des variante specifique d'arme qui fonctionne un peu different d'une autre arme de la meme categorie comme les shotgun qui tire des explosif ou une seul grosse balle a la place d'une gerbe de plomb, des mitrailleuse lourde ou des canon DCA qui tirent des obus, des lance grenade magnetique, des canon a sous-munition ...... la varitée est vraiment presente et sa fait plaisir.


( plus d'actualitée) Le gros probleme de ce jeux reside dans le mode multijoueur : tournant sous game for windows live ,il est tres mal optimiser pour jouer sur steam et les parties en multi se mettent a lagger de plus en plus, a point ou il faut relancer le jeux apres chaque bataille en multi pour rejouer dans de bonne conditions. Ce gros probleme aura vite fait fuir tout les joueur de cet exellent jeux mais qui perd enormement de son potentielle si on est obliger de jouer seul.(plus d'actualitée)

La bonne nouvelles c'est que les succes steam sont la, pas encore activer mais sa veut dire que le jeux na pas eter totalement oublier et sa me fait bien plaisir, je l'ai reinstaller et attend que les correctifs pour le lag en multi arrivent.

Pour resumer : selon moi c'est un des meilleur jeux du genre mais le lag catastrophique en multi  a fait fuir tout les joueur, quand il ne laggera plus ce jeux aurat tout pour devenir un "must have" pour ceux qui aime le style tower defense-action.

NEWS : Visiblement double-fine a repris les droit de son jeux et virer games for windows live ,j'ai essayer plusieur partie en ligne,  la perte de mes succés et ma sauvegarde est ô combien compensée par des parties fluide et sans le moindre petit ralentissement !!! Magnifique !!! ce jeux vas enfin redevenir totalement jouable et grace a son faible prix j'espere que ce jeux vas devenir une celebritée car il le merite vraiment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015447691', 'num_games_owned': 1325, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1491361315}
review: As it stands, this is an amazing game. If you enjoyed mech warrior then this game style will be a whole load of fun. There seems to be a lot of talk about bugs here in the comments but myself and 3 buddies played the game for almost a solid 7 hours and the only 'Crash' we had was one of our internet connections going down. None of us had any real issue getting in or playing the game. I will agree, the game need to be rid of Window Live and just work off of steam but the dev "Double Fine" has much bigger things to work on. So as much as I'd like to see more people playing this game, I understand why they haven't done much. It is hard for a smaller team like "Double Fine Productions" to keep up on all their games. I would recommend this game in a heartbeat.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990627522', 'num_games_owned': 11340, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 2145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2145, 'last_played': 1363849200}
review:
This game is something! Something for a few reasons.
First of all it's something fresh. Mix of TPP shooter, tower defense and mech simulator. And surprisingly this mix works very fine.
Second of all, it's very good game with great replayability.
Third of all, it's difficult game, in old-school way. For me it's advantage, but if you like easy games, I warned you.

VERDICT:
If you like tower defense games and looking for something fresh, try this one.
If you like shooters and mechs, you definitely should give this game a chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988012862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 326, 'playtime_forever': 862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 862, 'last_played': 1418792487}
review:
[i]UPDATE May 26, 2015: DoubleFine have removed GFWL from the game, added Steam matchmaking, and this fixes the infamous "stutter bug" (and also wipes all old saves). ([url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/115120/discussions/0/617336568087988501/]source[/url])[/i]

Co-op Iron Brigade is a lot of fun!

[strike]GFWL is not dead. I had a working GFWL install from playing FUEL, and was up and running in 5 minutes. However, if you haven't, you probably need the updated client, which is here: http://www.xbox.com/Live/PC/DownloadClient You can probably download and install this before you download iron Brigade, or you can install Iron Brigeade, uninstall GFWL, and then install the newer version. Make an account, copy and Ctrl-V paste the serial, done. (GFWL often takes a minute ro more to connect, and sometimes needs more than one attempt.)[/strike]

You need to play two missions in singleplayer; after that, you know the basics of the game and get access to the "radio room" where you can invite friends, search for games etc. [strike]"Friends" means GFWL friends and not Steam friends, of course, so you need to add each other on GFWL. [/strike]You can do in-game text-chat with "T"; [strike]if you have configured speech in the GFWL settings,[/strike] you'll also automatically have voice chat with everyone in your game [strike](if your microphone isn't claimed by Steam)[/strike]. The co-op missions are the same as the singleplayer missions, so you advance in singleplayer as you play co-op.

I like the co-op rules. You need to collect "scrap" (= drops from the enemies) to be able to build turrets; any scrap you collect (or that scrap collector turret collects) gets shared equally (as are the random chest drops), but any turrets you place go off your own budget. You can only build those turret types that you have equipped (they're called "emplacements" in the loadout screens), but you can upgrade any turrets on the battlefield regardless of type. Of course you can revive each other.

Tactics for us was to go into each new map with the same loadout as the previous one, slightly modified by the hints the game gives you. We were only defeated once, but then we do go back and refine our strategy for gold star performance. This means talking about weapon and turret loadaouts, turret placement strategy, fire sectors (very loose), and the like. We were already on the chassis that has a maximum of weapon slots and a minimum of turret slots, but careful planning was still necessary to get that coveted gold star: even at that extreme of the game balance spectrum, you can't just adopt "shoot everything that moves" as a viable tactic.

Game balance is excellent: chassis types allow you to trade weaponry (fps) against turrets (tower defense) -- this affects both the turret types you can equip and their cost. Special skills are equipped via legs, and they're balanced as well: "quick reload" means you're stationary while that skill is engaged; "sprint" means you're fast, but can't turn while running, etc. You need to use your skill wisely, i.e. tactically.

[strike]The "stutter bug": 6 hours into the game, after 7 missions, the game started stuttering when scrap is being collected. That bug is not present in the Xbox version, and the FAQ says that since it seems related to GFWL, it is difficult/impossible to debug, and Microsoft is not being helpful. So that bug is there to stay. Since you can't shoot while collecting scrap, you tend to only do that when no enemies are around, which means the bug is an annoyance, not a showstopper at this point.[/strike]

I got Iron Brigade for free when I bought "Hack'n'Slash", possibly because I previously owned a lot of Double Fine games, including at least one bundle (Amnesia Fortnight). Getting it on sale seems definitely worthwhile even now, [strike]but if you have an Xbox, you're probably better off getting it there, because of the stutter bug.[/strike]

As a game, Iron brigade is exceptionally well designed: it is easy to get into, has tactical depth, and allows for a wide variety of approaches to beating a level that are well balanced among each other, both in singleplayer and co-op.

For what it's worth I tried playing it before the GFWL shut down happened. And it kept losing connection to the GFWL servers. Which meant it would pause the game and ask me to log back in. In an action game that was unbearable so I left it alone. 

Either way don't bother with this. GFWL... 'Nuff said.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053399947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1626293139}
review:
A good third-person shooter / tower defense hybrid very similar to the Sanctum series right down the four player co-op mode with only slight difference in the way the games are balanced.

Where Iron Brigade really shines, however, is the aesthetic; your "mobile trench" (battle mech) looks like it just walked off of an Alt-History WWI battlefield and the weapons and emplacements you have access to as well as the USS McKinley fits right in while the the various Monovision monsters are dark cyberpunk creations that somehow look right facing off against your Diesel Punk combat walker.

A warning is required however as it is difficult/impossible to play co-op anymore due to the game's reliance on the largely defunct Games for Windows Live service.

EDIT:
As of a June 2015, Iron Brigade now uses Steamworks instead of Games for Windows Live, improving game preformance and making multiplayer far more easy to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114229085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1667750561}

author: {'steamid': '76561198069141738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1427577781}
review:
GforWL регистрировали минут 15 =). Сперва заходим в игру, жмем создать акк, переходим в браузер, вводим почту, подверждаем ее, регистрируемся, заходим в игру, вводим почту и пароль, дальше просит код (скопированный в буфер обмена), загружается акк (это займет пару минут, может перезагрузиться компьютер), снова входим в игру, вводим почту и пароль, что то опять всплывает (мол чего то не существует, жмем ок/да), переходим на сайт xbox, заходим в учетную запись, заходим в игру, играем. ВСЕ нужно проделать на одном дыхании. Игра играется на win 8.

На моей xp-ишке не запускается. Связано это скорей всего с железом, частенько конфликтует с играми, особенно с играми потертыми временем. Пишет ошибка приложения. Память не может быть read. Шерстил интернет на этот счет, не нашел ровным счетом ничего связанного с проблемами при запуске. Так что про поиграть в нее с девушкой пока забыл.

О САМОЙ ИГРЕ
Довольно давно играл, но игра запомнилась с хорошей стороны, особенно в плане геймплея. Было весьма занимательно подбирать траншею на свой вкус, в доступные слоты ставить подходящий набор оружия и орудий. Даже на англ. думаю не составит труда разобраться с этой составляющей игры. Сюжет мне не импонирует и запомнился больше как раздражающий с нудными заставками, которые в придачу не скипаются. 

В общем игра добротная. Купится железо (наверно не скоро), напишу получилось ли поиграть co-op.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075061382', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 893, 'last_played': 1418508422}
review:
This game is a really good twist on a Shooter/Tower Defense style which we have become rather used to with the likes of Sanctum and Dungeon defenders. While it does have GFWL (the plague) and also poor fps (Screen tearing on loading screens) what I will say is that the game is really enjoyable, great with friends, and I was really eager to continue onto every last mission with a small group.

Excellent Feel
Good Gameplay
Amazing Co-op Experience.

If this game is on sale (Like it was when I got it, I would really advise you to buy it)

author: {'steamid': '76561198100388140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 843, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1476599584}
review:
У нас есть робот, который можно апгрейдить за деньги, полученные за бой. Стиль обычный для защиты башнями - изо всех щелей бегут монстры, убиваем их сами или башнями, с монстров падают запчасти, за которые покупаем апгрейды башням.
Игра похожа на Sanctum 2 (не графически) и расчитана на несколько игроков. Одному играть сложно и скучно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072944925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1882, 'last_played': 1598387899}
review: All kind of stupid fun with heavy walking trenches (a.k.a mechs) and broad choice of deadly weaponry, ranging from high-speed machine guns to massive mortars. With up to three friends you can go nuts crushing all kinds of broadcast means (hello, YouTube haters ;) and building your own fort. Yeah, defensive turrets are here too - it's a tower defence after all... Yet, your personal turret in not just idly standing, waiting for the enemies to come - it's a lumbering warmachine, that can walk right to the big, ugly tube and beat the crap out of it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043590615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 175, 'playtime_at_review': 4613, 'last_played': 1710532122}
review:
Loved this game, though it came out during the windows live era I believe which I think hurt it's ability to grow since online play was disabled for a while when they shut that down. It wasn't until they patched it to steam was I able to play with friends again and we had a blast, but by then the player base dwindled or people opted not to buy it with all the negative reviews from windows live. It's been a while so I can't remember how often crashes happened as I remember that being the only main issue. You can play most levels just fine unless you're doing endless mode and eventually it would happen so I was never able or had the patience to get the better guns on the highest wave difficulties.
Mech customization was awesome, pretty simple and straight forward. Big mechs gave you big guns, sacrificing turret slots and vice versa. Story was simple and decent, blending into the gameplay well and not taking too much of your time up.
I always wished there would be a sequel with a lot of improvements and maybe randomized loot for better re-play ability purposes, but that's only a dream for now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046915762', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1414943970}
review:
[h1][u][b]Mech(自機)をカスタマイズ/操作し拠点を守るステージクリア型のTPS＋TD[/b][/u][/h1]

モノビジョン(敵)の来襲から人類を守り脅威を殲滅していくのがストーリーの流れ。ヨーロッパ、アフリカ、太平洋、果ては火星までを転戦しながらの4ステージ/各5ミッション(計20＋サバイバル3)が戦いの舞台となる。感想としてはユーザースコアの51がかなり意外に感じる程に楽しめた。TD好きな人はセール時に購入を検討しても損は無い。

[h1][b]プラス評価[/b][/h1]

-Mechのカスタマイズ要素、自機/武器/ポッドのレべリング要素
Mechのカスタマイズ要素はシャーシ(本体)、ポッド、レッグ、カラーの4種に大別できる。シャーシによって強い/沢山(弱い/少なく)武器が積載可能なもの、ポッド積載数(多い少ない)の違い、自機の装甲やスピードが強い(弱い)ものと個性がある。更に武器(6種)やレッグにも各種特色のある個性があり、ポッドも含めた独自の組み合わせによってお気に入りの自機を組み上げた上で戦う事が可能となる。ステージの地形や敵の種類、自分の好みのプレイスタイルに応じてポッドでの殲滅を優先するか？自機での撃破を優先するか？バランス型で行くのか？等、都度構成や組み立てを考えられる点やスタイルの異なる遊び方が出来る点は面白い要素。

加えて上記カスタイマイズ可能なアイテムには全てレベルが存在する。無論高レベルのものは性能も高く、中にはスペシャルアビリティを持つものも。各アイテムはショップでの購入 or ステージクリア報酬で入手。Lvの低い機体、武器、ポッドをそれぞれ時間をかけてレベルアップ＝強力化していけばスキルを補う事も出来るデザインになっている。

-個性あふれる敵
小さい敵から中くらいの敵、飛行型から中ボス的な大きめの敵、ステージ毎に存在する4体のボス。それぞれ見た目や攻撃方法、攻撃ターゲットが異なっておりAIの個性付けが上手く出来ている。完全な余談になるがチューブ(敵)の一部は映画版「All You Need is Kill」のエイリアンに酷似。

[h1][b]マイナス評価[/b][/h1]

-ポッドの種類や戦場へ持ち込める数が少ない
種類はライト(4種)、サポート(3種)、ヘビー(4種)。戦場へ持ち込めるポッド数は2～4種となる為、どうしても取り回しが便利なポッド利用の頻度が高まる＝戦略が硬直化しやすい弊害を起こしてしまっている。

-ミッション中は全体を俯瞰できるようなミニマップが無くどのルートからどの敵が襲来するか判別しづらい

-ステージ開始や途中に入るムービーシーンのスキップが不可＝テンポ悪

[h1][b]その他[/b][/h1]
-オンラインCOOP実装
過疎の為、ほぼマッチング不可。実質フレンドCOOP専用。未プレイ
-未だにGFWL対応(2014年11月時)かつSTEAM実績が解除不能(GFWL実績のみ可)
各問題に対してもフォーラムを見る限り上デベロッパ側で対応する予定は無さげ。気にする人は要注意。
-日本語対応

author: {'steamid': '76561197999346443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 1170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1170, 'last_played': 1402785310}
review:
A third person view mech shooter variation on tower defense genre, dipped in signature Double Fine humor sauce. If that sounds appealing to you, think no more, get it. It does its job very well!

You're a pilot of so-called mobile trench in a campaign against Monovision ravaging the world after mysterious Broadcast. The tongue-in-cheek campaign consists of missions tasking you with defense of a strategic point(s) from waves of enemies spawning at concrete locations on map and converging on their target. You fight partly yourself directly, dealing out punishment from guns mounted on your mechanized trench, and partly you summon turrets for help, paying for them with scrap gathered from fallen enemies.

There's a big selection of guns at your disposal - machine guns for relatively small but sustained damage, with flak variety focusing on airborne enemies, and a wide selection of burst damage weapons varying in range, area of effect, and reload times (shotguns, sniper rifles, grenade launchers, even artillery cannons). There's also a unique type of weapon - broadcasters, with huge, continuous damage, but very short range and long time to replenish (sort of like EMP version of flamethrower, I guess).

And all these guns also come in a standalone, turret version, automatically tageting enemies in their range, except broadcaster type of turret is not for damage but rather a support one, slowing enemies down, and there's a type of turret that lays mines rather than shoots at enemies. Other support turrets include magnets that  automatically gather scrap for you or can repair your trench.

(by the way, normally your mechanized trench CAN'T be blown up during a mission, you're just disabled for a short time and only lose when defended target is blown up, however stages of campaign end with boss fights where you yourself can be considered the target and then repair turret sure comes handy - or pretty much required)

There's a gotcha however - a harsh limit on what you can actually bring with you to a single mission, and mixing and matching a loadout before launch is big part of your success. Generally you can either go with a chassis that can dish out huge damage itself with lots of gun mounts, but very poor selection of turrets to summon, or a chassis that can deploy powerful turrets but has very limited space for guns on itself (there's also a middle ground, having an average number of gun mounts and limited only to light offensive turrets). These also differ in speed and armor values, and come with a choice of legs that give you some special move, for example let you sprint very fast in straight line, or give option for faster reload times if you root yourself in place. There's also a smashing variety of legs that complements your damage potential.

The selection of guns is ever expanding in their power and sometimes additional effects (like more scrap, or magnetic effect on grenades - very useful perk), you have this feeling of constant progress in power as you level up your pilot, very well realized indeed (but of course mission difficulty also ramps up to match it).

With rumors on GFWL closing down soon-ish and Double Fine not planning to port this game over to a different platform, it may be highest time to get this one, too, before it becomes unplayable (though it's not clear if it won't work at all or just the co-op version? btw yes there's co-op)

author: {'steamid': '76561198065638436', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1559668852}

author: {'steamid': '76561198006807587', 'num_games_owned': 4228, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 1377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1377, 'last_played': 1402178299}
review:
Перед нами отличный гибрид между "Tower defence" и простым экшном от 3 лица(можно сказать, что это среднее между "Sanctum" и  "Lost Planet". У нас в распоряжении шагающий робот(мобильная траншея по-местному, на дворе - время первой мировой, только с уклоном в фантастику), против нас выступают, скажем так, телевизорные монстры, распространяющие МОНОВИДЕНИЕ, после своей гибели щедро посыпающие землю кинескопами.
Сеттинг получился незаезженным, приправлен шутками и разными забавными мелочами (с серьезной миной такую истотрию просто нельзя рассказывать!), чего только стоит разное дурачество с простыми жестами приветствия на корабле, которые мы получаем, покупая шапки (да, и здесь они).
Сам геймплей прост - мобы прутся по известным линиям, мы защищаем важные объекты, постреливая из пушек и строя башни. Еще есть большие боссы, сражения с которыми по-своему интересны.
 Оружия(от пулеметов до лазеров) и траншей здесь много, каждый может сделать билд под себя, поэтому особенно ценна игра в кооператива, где можно и нужно себя пробовать в специализированной роли боевого или инженерного меха.
Минусом здесь будет - GFWL. Пока вроде его и не планируют убирать, а это значит, что самое ценное - кооператив, пропадет. Впрочем, у Вас еще есть время до 1 июля 2014, а там может все-таки удалят ненавистный сервис из игры)

Итого - интересная игра для веселых пострелушек вместе с друзьями, подпорченная присутствием GFWL.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991245044', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 1125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1125, 'last_played': 1401288181}
review:
The following was written prior to the GFWL removal - the game is now fully recommended.

Unfortunately, as the game current;y stands (May 2014), I can not recommend this game.   While the concept is quite fun, the number of bugs that exist due to Games for Windows Live makes the experience unenjoyable.  This is not a condemnation of GfWL, but rather entirely due to a bug caused by its implementation.   In short, a memory leak is introduced that, after a couple minutes, causes the system to begin delaying frames.   As levels drag on, this eventually renders the game unplayable.

While this bug can be remedied in the campaign missions by quitting the game and restarting it after every mission, this option is not possible when playing the survival modes (which I would consider to be the most challenging aspect of the game.)

If Double Fine is ever able to remove the GfWL loader, then I will whole-hearedly recommend this product.  But until that time, any enjoyment of the game is ruined by the experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970515810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 1364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1357, 'last_played': 1432833594}
review: Double Fine makes great games, and this one is no exception. Tower defense + Mech offense = Helluvalotafun.  Unfortunately, as mentioned in other reviews, this game has some serious problems on PC.  Serious lag/stuttering in the later levels make the game barely playable.  I got up to level 13, where I really needed some help, but I heard things even get worse in multiplayer, so I didn't bother finishing the game.  Double Fine blames Microsoft (publisher) and Games for Windows Live, but really the game shouldn't have been released in this state. If you get a chance to play this on XBox 360, it is well worth your time.  It is fun on PC as well, just realize you may not want to play the last few levels.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982515237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1125, 'last_played': 1433306345}
review:
The multiplayer doesn't work. Don't waste your money.

EDIT:
Three years after this game's release and two months after the big Steam update, multiplayer still doesn't actually work. It mostly works when you have two players (though to be fair I was also able to play most of the campaign originally as co-op two players with only minor problems) but the game was clearly designed and sold around larger groups, which still don't work. Don't waste your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967500590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 718, 'last_played': 1475333375}
review:
Ein Spiel welches sein Potenzial erst im Multiplayer entfalten kann und dieses auch tut.
Hervorzuheben sind hier auch die Sprüche und Texte, die den bekannten Humor von Double Fine Productions hervorragend transportieren, man muss aber schon aufpassen um diese mitzubekommen.

Von den Fehlern die dieses Spiel haben und damit den Koopmodus unspielbar machen soll, haben wir in mehreren Stunden nichts gemerkt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041849089', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1847, 'last_played': 1603565955}
review: Ce jeu pourrait être bien, si ce nétait pas un Microsoft Live. Le serveur rame. Formatez votre PC, vous retournez dessus, vous ne retrouverez jamais votre compte. J'avais 30h de jeu et toutes les armes, je n'ai plus rien. Merde à ces crevards de Microsoft.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025726174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2531, 'last_played': 1394233398}
review:
4.5/5 for this one, Double Fine delivers nicely.

Being a fan of the more hands-on third person defense game genre, I had high hopes for Iron Brigade, and it met those expectations beautifully. The personality in the game had me chuckling as my mates and I, kitted out in our multi coloured walking 'trenches', blast away wave after wave of downright impressive looking enemies. Diverse story maps, a hoard of loot and a garage load of customisation made this game a sure win.

Gameplay is entertaining and flexible, three types of trench giving you the choice between 'I'll kill it!' and 'Build ALL the turrets', and somewhere in between. Tactical placement decisions and rationing upgrade costs keeps your gears turning, and unique weapons and alternatives to standard turrets keep evolving your playstyle, which all comes together in the adequately challenging survival modes.

The negatives are few, but are as follows. I personally found the final map to be a bit underwhelming, the end of the game putting a single sour note on an otherwise awesome storyline. Wrestling with Games for Window's Live also made getting set up a bit of an issue, but that really can't be helped by Double Fine, so I won't hold it against them. Lastly, the game stutters nastily if your computer isn't up to scratch at handling the numerous turrets placed on an extended map, but that's likely just my old laptop struggling.

Overall, this is a game I'm very glad I bought, and will likely put more hours into it in the future. I didn't expect any less, and I wasn't even slightly disappointed. A definate must buy for all fans of the defense strategy franchise.

review:
I'm a big double fine fan and the idea of Mechas in WW2 was enough to prompt me to buy the game. It's not a bad game, but it feels really mediocre. The tower defense setup feels like it's wasting a lot of potential here and even though the game says it can be played solo, the boss battles pretty much require at least 2 players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060236227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 753, 'last_played': 1393481508}
review:
タワーディフェンス・ロボットアクション。
定められた位置から出現する敵から防衛目標を守り切るゲーム。
防衛は各機能を持ったポッドを設置するか、自身で敵を攻撃することで
凌ぐことになる。また、機体・武器・所持ポッド・外見を自身の好みに
改造することができ、自分にあった戦術を取ることができる。

ただ上記のようにプレイの戦術幅が広いように見えるが、このゲームの
ソロプレイはアクション部分を重視したプレイをしていると敵への対応
に追われクリアが難しくなる。そのため、より早く効率的に要塞化させ、
ポッドに敵を任せられるようにする必要があり、決まった武器・ポッド
のみを選択・使用するためマンネリになりがち。
coopはある程度挽回できるため好きな武器を好きなだけ使えるので楽し
くプレイできた。

ソロは効率性を求めるゲーム、coopはフレンドと楽しくプレイできる
ゲーム。日本語対応。GFWL対応ゲームのため注意。

author: {'steamid': '76561197970887820', 'num_games_owned': 4511, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 1009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1009, 'last_played': 1494683238}
review:
This game is hilariously fun. Those of you familiar with Tim Shaefer and Double Fine Studios wll already be familiar with the kinds of quirks their games provide and this is no different. 

Its essentially a tower defence game only its fought in the third person and you control an active unit on the battle field, a massive hulking robot called a Mobile Trench. In each area you have several areas to defend and a certain time limit to set everything up before the enemy come in. Rather than do this from an overhead view, you stomp your trench around and set up assorted turrets on available building platforms, trying to create the right sort of deadly crossfire. 

You have to think on your feet once the attacks starts as they foes will becoming from all directions and you can only be in on place at a time, so what do you rebuild? Your own trench is heavily armed and can be upgraded between missions. You can collect loot boxes that drop from powerful enemies that can give you powerful new equipment to customise your mech with.

 The games atmosphere is an over the top setting remeniscent of a fictional world war one with anachronistic technology. The sense of humour is kinda crazy, I chose as my character a dapper British dude whose trench came equiped with a humidor for his cigars, at the end of every battle he would light up a cigar.......with his pistol. 

It also has multiplayer an immensely fun co-op mode for up to four players. Get it.

8 out of 10

author: {'steamid': '76561197968671893', 'num_games_owned': 9182, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1414397151}
review:
Awesome 3rd person tower defense style game by Double Fine.

Unfortunately it's infected with GFWL which causes lag/stuttering issues for some people, and is going to be shut down soon as well.

It's ok as a single player game but it's best played with other people.
Sadly there are very few people actively playing it so the best way to get a game going is probably with the forums. 

If the game gets GFWL stripped I would definitely recommend it, but until it does you're just going to get your heart broken.
