author: {'steamid': '76561198013088993', 'num_games_owned': 724, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 1046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 936, 'last_played': 1433768442}
review:
Iron Brigade is an excellent Tower Defense/Mech Shooter hybrid, with fairly satisfying weapons and a nice WW1 theme-with-a-twist.

Also, the game has now been ported over to Steamworks and the 'stutter' bug that once made playing the game migraine-inducing is gone.  As it stands, the only bug I've encountered is random disconnects in the multiplayer lobby, and even that's a minor inconvenience at worst.

All-in-all, I find it very hard not to recommend Iron Brigade, especially if you have friends on hand who are also fans of Tower Defense or Mech games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986219590', 'num_games_owned': 2278, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1356854400}
review:
Iron Brigade is a great game that you should not buy. The concept and gameplay are great - tower defense plus mech action is a great combination, especially in such a clever and amusing setting.

But the bugs and other problems make it nearly unplayable. The game is locked at 30 frames per second. There are persistent performance issues that cause frequent half-second pauses (the infamous "scrap stutter" bug). Sometimes scripts don't trigger and you have to erase all of your progress (manually, since the game autosaves frequently and doesn't have an in-game option to clear your data) because the game has been rendered unfinishable. And it uses Games For Windows Live, which Double Fine has "no plans" to remove, despite the service's impending shutdown in the middle of this year.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007202016', 'num_games_owned': 370, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 896, 'last_played': 1389455993}
review:

DLCでもいいし、新作をぜひ期待したいところ。

author: {'steamid': '76561197998460830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 486, 'last_played': 1423495530}
review:
Its not often you get a game with its own unique characters in a cheesy setting that stragely enough works well for it and then throw in the gameplay which is surprisingly simple but can be unforgiving at times if you don't pay attention and you have a good game called Iron Brigade...oh did i mention it has MECHS!!!

While i LOVE this game the fact that it requires Games for Windows Live to play online is a big detractor but not many play this game that much anymore and you'll be hard pressed to find anyone willing to put up with GfWL and all the BS that comes with it to even bother trying to play online.

overall 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198061042984', 'num_games_owned': 1445, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 3085, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 731, 'last_played': 1589260887}
review: A gritty-battle in parrallel universe.  With art styles dating back to WWII and a unique perspective of what one man and a ton of turrets can do to a hell-bent madmen with a boat-load of monsters coined tubes.  Unique game play makes this game replayable countless times, The multiplayer offers way to beat troublesome level and learn different techniques.  This game is definitely worth a look to anyone who enjoys a good mech-styled game and fun customization.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038749202', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1397279585}
review:
The most "gamey" of Double Fine's efforts so far and arguably the best of them. I like mechs. I like loot. Mix the the two together with a funny premise and Double Fine's signature offbeat humour and you have Iron Brigade (Trenched for us purists out there). Best consumed with company, Iron Brigade is a great co-op game. Play alone and you'll be bummed out.

Unfortunately, the game is locked at 30 frames per second. Though that's perfectly playable, my laptop can do better than that. Moreover, the shadow of GFWL hangs heavy over this game. Microsoft owns the IP, which means you have to go through another layer of tedious account verification to play this thing. 
Recommended with caveats.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965405472', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1437057896}
review:
This game uses Games for Windows Live. The service is broken and Microsoft is ending it soon. As GFWL is broken for me I cannot even play this game, so big thumbs down. Even the link for password recovery in GFWL is broken. Last Double Fine product I will buy.

edit:
I can confirm that GFWL has been removed. However, the game is still broken for me because there seems to be no way for me to turn off my joystick from being in use when I have it connected to the game, and it's conflicting with the menu selection. I've have honestly NEVER had this issue with any other game, so it's perplexing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970331674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1388258978}
review: Mid-Budget Xbox Arcade Tower Defense Titel mit Design-Macken: Gebaute Turrets lassen sich nicht entfernen, die arg begrenzte, richtige Auswahl an gleichzeitig mitzunehmenden Turret-Arten ergibt sich meist erst während der Missionen, Zwischensequenzen lassen sich auch bei Missionswiederholungen nicht überspringen, zwischen den Menüpunkten muss die Spielfigur hin und her laufen. Dafür motiviert das Finden, Aufrüsten und Ausprobieren von speziellen Ausrüstungs- und Waffenitems. Für ein paar Euro insgesamt auf jedenFall unterhaltsam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027819327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 46278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37361, 'last_played': 1599392770}
review:
A game about love

There are no regrets about love. You can't buy love. But you can buy Iron Brigade.
Where there is love, there is always something to hate too. Here it is gfwl. 
But love is bigger than hate. Iron Brigade is bigger than gfwl. 

While this gem has it's flaws, it's a most enjoyable experience.
If you aren't burned by the hate of a thousand suns, when you
hear the acronym gfwl, you will find something unique here.

There are also a bunch of decent folks around the forums,
looking to form a merry suicidal squad for coop games.

Update:
======
GFWL has been removed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027944021', 'num_games_owned': 551, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 1079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 839, 'last_played': 1452347921}
review:
トレンチという名のロボットに乗り込み敵と戦うTPSタワーディフェンス。
ストレスたまるけど一人でもクリアできる。
というかストレスためながら一人でクリアした。

意外とトレンチは動かない。ジャンプができないので地形によっては結構ストレス。
けっこう仕上がってるゲームなのでもうちょっとボリュームがあったらよかった。
これやってるとマヴラヴのTPSタワーディフェンス作ってくれねーかなーってすげー思う。
もっとトレンチをウィンウィン動かしてスタイリッシュタワーディフェンスをしたかった。

Xboxライブアーケードなので公式で日本語化＆XBOX実績に対応。
$7くらいで買えるなら十分楽しめる。
マルチは人がまったくいないのでソロでやるマゾっ気のある人か友達と一緒に買うなりしよう。

author: {'steamid': '76561197981052853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 5662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5260, 'last_played': 1489413846}
review:
アーマードコアとは一味も二味も違う無骨なロボシューティング。
ブーストスラスターで素早く移動とかできません。
地にしっかり足をつけて歩いて行きましょう。

銃の発砲感や、エフェクトが派手で気持ちイイ。

「やっぱロボゲーって、アーマードコアよりも鉄騎だよね」って方にオススメ。

coopもできます！（人が居れば）

author: {'steamid': '76561197984944913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 892, 'last_played': 1446256581}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968299414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1370677849}
review: The humorous tone meets expectations for a Double Fine production, and the underlying tower defense design is sound.  An otherwise fun concept is held back by off-scale mech animation and visual projectile feedback that lacks punch.  In a game based entirely on shooting things while piloting a robot, these are not nitpicks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042374622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2976, 'last_played': 1532919770}
review: TPSのタワーディフェンスゲーム、トレンチ(機体)を操り なんかエイリアン的ななにかから拠点を守る感じ。トレンチ(機体)を戦場に合わせてカスタマイズしたり工夫をして敵の猛攻を凌ごう d(｀・ω・´ )　ウェーブが後半のほうになるにつれ少し重くなりカクついたりするのが少し難だが、十分遊べると思う。

author: {'steamid': '76561198002804113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1374506789}
review:
[h1]Rating: 7/10[/h1]

Double Fine does it again with yet another game that is very enjoyable. Takes inspiration from the MechWarrior games and adds Tower Defense to it. Lots of customization options, addictive gameplay and great voice acting add a lot to the fun factor of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970329460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1345273200}
review: A fun twist on tower defense with mechs in a 40's/50's style...would have loved to play this more but unfortunately i got it around the same time as some other truly amazing games. Will be revisiting in the slow summer months. 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198055865509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1433022778}
review:
This game was broken and was a pity because the coop idea is very good. GFWL is now removed and so the main complaint is also gone. However, there are still ways to improve this game, like removing the 30 fps cap; yes, at 30 fps it is almost unplayable on PC.

You can't just port a game from consoles to PC; you have to adapt it to take advantage of the more capable gaming station which is a PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025386786', 'num_games_owned': 1739, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1369492988}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010187799', 'num_games_owned': 2805, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1368946800}
review:
Игра оказалась неожиданно неплохой: в отличие от большинства Tower Defence, Iron Brigade сильно ограничивает игрока в выборе средств обороны и имеет хорошее разнообразие уровней, это приятно усложняет игру. Своего "меха" можно снаряжать достаточно разным вооружением, но нет совершенно универсального оружия.

Игра должна быть интересна в коопе, но многое портит Windows Live и плохая графика.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997740965', 'num_games_owned': 7968, 'num_reviews': 2015, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1361433600}
review: Игра пыталась угнаться за многими жанрами, но догнать не смогла. Я не буду ругать ее за графику, бредовый сюжет и тд. Геймплей действительно затянет игрока на несколько часов. author: {'steamid': '76561197997244095', 'num_games_owned': 2038, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1359705600}
review:
Коротко - разочарование. 
До этого все игры Тима Шейфера игрались на ура, а тут.. провал.

Слишком унылый геймплей этой вариации на тему ТД. Тут можно пройти любой уровень вообще без башен (навесил кучу пушек на толстое шасси и зажал кнопку огонь). В кооперативе любой уровень проходится тупо с расстановкой башен в рэндомном порядке, а играть одному - убийство (просто не интересно). Лучше поиграть в Dungeon Defenders или Orcs Must Die!, чем тратить время на это.

Оценка 6.5/10. 
Строго рекомендуется тем, кто любит бегать с зажатой гашеткой и минимум думать. Любители вдумчивой расстановки башен будут разочарованы как я (много экшена, примитивные карты)
Дошёл до Африки. Дальше проходить не тянет)

P.S. Единственное, что в игре удалось - это весёлый сюжет, шутки и озвучка. В остальном - скукота (вроде и пушек тьма и графика глаз не режет, но играть не интересно, экшен часть перевешивает мозговую).

author: {'steamid': '76561198030006913', 'num_games_owned': 6506, 'num_reviews': 386, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1495478398}
review:
흥미로운 설정을 가지고 있는 타워디펜스로 참호를 발전시켜 만든 로봇을 조종해 총을 쏘면서, 군데군데 타워를 설치하여 아군 시설을 방호하는 게임. 단 타워 판매가 안된다.

설정도 흥미롭고 조작도 좋고 게임 내 연출은 정말 좋지만, 레알 사람 빡치게하는게 GFWL -_-
잘못걸리면 컨트롤이 전부 죽으며 (DirectX문제라 카더라) 중간중간 이유없이 튕긴다.
오류만 아니면 정말 좋은게임인데....

author: {'steamid': '76561198045280023', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1359792000}
review: 마소팩에 껴있어서 하게됬는데 생각보다 잼있습니다. 일단 4인 코옵까지 되는 디펜스 게임인데 래밸도 있고 로봇에 달수있는 무기나 터릿종류도 나름 다양하고 파일럿 관련 의상탬? 이런것도 상점에서 구입가능하더군요 ㅎㅎ;; 기체 페인팅도 할수있구요. 기체도 본체랑 다리파츠를 어떻게 바꾸냐에 따라 용도가 빌드용 전투용 이런 스탈로 나눌수도 있구요. 암튼 기대안했던 게임인데 솔솔한 재미를 줍니다~

author: {'steamid': '76561197979987727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 662, 'last_played': 1433018101}
review: I guess this was actually an undertaking by a pretty small dev team, but it's pretty darn cool. It's a tower defense with a lot of emphasis on getting your own hands dirty with your big-ass battle mech thing called a Trench. You and your stuff are all WW2-styled and the bad guys are retro-futuristic TV tube monsters, so the whole game has a pretty awesome asthetic. Mech customization is addictive and the weapons are fun. Solid and entertaining overall; has just the right amount of depth for me. I mean, I stood on top of my house-sized evil robot killer and shotgunned an entire bottle of 80-proof liquor right through my gas mask. What about it? Hell yeah, that's what.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013206158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 1788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1712, 'last_played': 1527857426}
review: towerdefence with huge customizable robots, funny humor, great game, a bit of a story, including the dlc (after you finished the story that is. Leveling is also a go aswell as Coop mode with i prefer the moost of this game but single player is a lot of fun aswell. can be a bit of a grind from time to time, but hey thats moostly a part of any game these days.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966427715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1164, 'last_played': 1615798618}
review:
・Xbox版が面白かったので購入。
ただしソロのみ。ソロなら神ゲー一歩手前。
・PC版らしくグラフィック設定項目が多少増えたけどかゆいところには届いてない。
・目に付くのはそれくらいでその他は本当にもうベタ移植。
・低コストで開発した（んだろう）けどそれを逆手にとったアメリカンなゲーム展開はいいと思う。
・XboxLive特有のラグラグ外人勢とのマッチングシステムまでベタ移植。
・オンでやると切断はザラ。
突然いなくなるパーティメンバー。君の建てたタレットはおいしくいただきました。通信が非常に安定しない。そして最後に俺もいなくなる。
・建物増えるとその傾向は顕著。ひどい通信。
・低pingな人たちと集まれるならオンもおもしろい。けど通信が安定することは稀。
・非常に惜しいゲーム。続編がしっかり予算掛けて作られるなら神ゲーになり得る。

author: {'steamid': '76561197996140508', 'num_games_owned': 1110, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1354435200}

review: This game is everything I've wanted in a Third Person Shooter / Tower Defense. Funny story, Giant Robots (always a win), and brilliant action. It's as if Sanctum and Hawken had a love child, and hired Tim Schafer to read it bedtime stories from 'Baby's First WWII'. My only complaint is that GFWL is causing the 'Scrap Stutter' issue. 9/10. Excellent show.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029279631', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1380143131}

author: {'steamid': '76561198014703938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1068, 'last_played': 1353571200}
review: Ok here is the deal, the game has some good ideas and pretty fun gameplay but is unplayable due to various bugs and connection issues related to gfwl. These issues have not been fixed for over two months and double fine stopped responding to forumgoers. Even if they eventually fix the game it has already taken way too long, my advice is stay far far away from double fine games I know this was the first and last time I buy one of their games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977081885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 369, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1371426315}

author: {'steamid': '76561198006636652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1346050800}
review:
When i first installed the game i was very dissapointed. But mostly because the game uses the Games for Windows Live system, which is absolutely horrible.

But on to the game. It's almost awesome. The first hour is tedious, but after that it gets progressively more fun. You want to go back and get perfect scores on maps to get extra experience points and bonuses, but that seems to me to max out a bit too soon.
The idea and the awesome mechs and fun characters would do well within a bigger game.
If it's on cheap, you like mechs, tower-defense games and/or FPS shooters, then it's definently reccomended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961123003', 'num_games_owned': 658, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1459, 'last_played': 1347951600}
review: Incredibly fun mobile tower defence game, especially when played in co-op mode. Warning: Uses GFWL and stutters quite frequently due to PC port issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061613871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2612, 'last_played': 1360656000}
review:
低価格帯のTPSロボットゲーです。
ミッションをクリアしていくと、レベルが上がり装備出来る武装の種類が増えていきます。
また、ミッションでショップには売っていないアイテム等も入手出来ます。

基本的にミッションはそれほど難しく無いです。
鉄鬼のキャンペーンより面白いですｗ

ひとつこのゲームに難点があり、協力プレイ時にテレビを回収するとラグが発生します。
回収中はカクカクするので、その点が難点かと思います。
おそらくバグ、メモリリーク。（全員再起動で一時的に直るはず）

ボリュームは低価格帯と言う事もあり、それほどありませんが、
友達とワイワイ楽しむにはとても良い出来だと思います。

author: {'steamid': '76561197979084213', 'num_games_owned': 4498, 'num_reviews': 1009, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1450819149}
review:
Iron Brigade was a bit of a let down for me. While it is a solid tower defense game, the enemies and maps just lack any personality and originality. I know Double Fine isn't the biggest company there is, and that there were several teams working on three different games basically all at the same time, but Iron Brigade lacks the charm  (not the humor) of Stacked and Costume Quest. 
For a TD game Iron Brigade definitely has a lot of customization. Pretty much anything can be customized. Your trench, marine, turrets and weapons.
Killed enemies will sometimes also drop loot boxes that give you random new gear.
The game certainly doesn't disappoint in that department.
And unlike other TD games, the game will (properly) increase in difficulty as you progress.
There was a bit of a performance issue later on in the game, where it would freeze for a second while collecting scrap. Nothing major, but worth noting anyway.
Now if only the maps and enemies were more diverse...

[Rating: 75/100]

author: {'steamid': '76561197999391939', 'num_games_owned': 495, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1345446000}
review: Bought this game to try out some trenchin' co-op with my friend and was not disappointed. This game is unique and has a cool concept, good humor, and some fun mechanics. The only letdown that I have with the game is the lag that seems to increase as gameplay goes on and you're picking up scrap (hopefully it gets fixed soon). It is a fresher take on mech warfare, with some added tower defense esque gameplay. You play as a marine in your mobile trench (cool concept imo) and are faced off against an enemy known as "the broadcast". Your main goal of the game is to takedown the broadcast and pretty much build the best trench you can. The trench is customizable with a nice selection of cores, legs, emplacements, and various types of weapons. The emplacements add the tower defense aspect, and they assist you in different ways (flak guns for air, machine guns, repair cranes, etc), I just wish they were a little more useful then they tend to be. Anways... buy this game. You won't be disappoint.

review:
How does driving a huge stompy war machine around a battlefield, calling for artillery-launched automated turrets sent to the location of your choosing, and blasting the crap out of monsters I can best describe as cathode ray tube televisions made in to multi-ton glowing murder-badgers sound?

Because if it sounds fun, you may want to give this game a look.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009661710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 902, 'last_played': 1485595184}
review: It's similar to Sanctum, but at a much faster pace and instead of a person, you control a mecha that levels up. Only complaint is that you can't skip cutscenes, but in their defense, the voice acting is pretty spot on.

review:
I was excited to see this ported to PC and available on steam. Double Fine always does a great job with simple yet evocative gameplay.

Sadly, I cannot recommed based on the technical snafus like locked frame rate (maxes at 30), poor ported console interface, and requiring games for windows live.

If they could get it to 60 fps, I would give it a 4/5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025165199', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2842, 'last_played': 1445203406}
review:
One of the finer co-op shooties around.

IB takes a twist on the tower defense formula and delivers! You've got a choice to be a badass  mobile weapon platform or just plunk them down, while sporting a dandy moustache! The game is great value for money, solo or with buddies. And with controller, you get analogue saluting! What more could a duder ask! Brilliant!

review: A surprisingly fun 3rd person tower defense game. Either focus on making your walking trench insane or beef up your towers. The break away from the traditional grid layout for towers to a freeform one is a welcome change. Intuitive and entertaining, check it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990152763', 'num_games_owned': 2031, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 1299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1433877535}
review:
if you take a very simplified version of armored cores loadout scheme, remove all the extra fluff for silly stats, then turn it into an awesome actiony shootery, still somehow tower defense oriented mech explosion, you have this game.

There are a few latency issues with people from long distance, see brazil and russia, but overall I have yet to experience many of them when playing with friends within the same country.  

Graphically its nice, keep in mind this was built with a set limit on its size due to being an Xbox live title. but you really can't tell otherwise, the PC controls are top notch.

review:
Pink WWI-era Mechs! I mean, Mobile Trenches. The customization and loot options are surprisingly robust, making this a neat hero/tower defense game where the guns feel ballsy enough. Very recommended with 3 friends. The theme and writing is also properly silly, now all I need is some giant moustache prop upgrades for my mec... trench.

POST SCRIPTUM EDIT EDIT: Changing this to back to a positive review since they have finally fixed the loot lag and kicked GFWL out! The game can finally be played with 4 players without the stuttering!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032169354', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 7747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5696, 'last_played': 1468771645}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969776006', 'num_games_owned': 349, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2202, 'last_played': 1505287656}
review:
Fun as hell, I highly recomend it if you want to play with your friends. While early parts of the campaign can be done solo they are best done with friends. The graphics are nice and the plot while predictable is enjoyable and fun. You won't find incredible depth to the story but the game allows yo uto customize your Trench (the griant robot machines of carnage) to your playstyle with loot you earn or buyable shop items.

THE BAD! The worse thing has to be the co-op right now, the match making system can take a new player that is literally on the 1rst campaign mission and toss them with players that are at the end game, the new player ends up being like a flat tire on the team as they don't have the firepower to be useful on later missions. Sometimes the co-op slows down big time- whether its because of junky net code or game engine is not optimized the very thing that makes this game enjoyable also hinders it. 

A promising game if they improve it and they should, cuz its fun

author: {'steamid': '76561197960405535', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1345100400}
review: Great little game, make sure to play it with friends. It has a slight case of port-itis, mostly aggravated by the sub-par GFWL implementation slapped on by Microsoft. If you like Double FIne, mech combat, or tower defence, you'll have a good time!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982630533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 2518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2164, 'last_played': 1432810723}
review:
Update: There are still some issues with GFWL implementation in this game. It is very common to experience dropped sessions in multiplayer, and doing so often causes you to be booted out of the mission entirely. Additionally there is an extremely annoying sound glitch on the free-DLC missions (which represent about 25% of the total game length), which evidently also has to do with GFWL but occurs in whichever mode you play. 

When GFWL is phased out soon, it is uncertain if Iron Brigade will ever be patched to continue supporting multiplayer at all-- Microsoft is the publisher for Iron Brigade and DoubleFine can't fix this unless Microsoft tells them to, reportedly. Even so, as things stand now the lobby system drops your friends constantly and there's no way around it, so multiplayer as it stands right now requires a lot of patience and luck.

Original Review: It's very good. I've stayed up late two nights playing it already (16 hrs total, haven't finished it yet, though I've been replaying missions a lot to get gold medals). It's skewed heavily towards action but it's still a tower defense game, which I usually avoid but big stompy mechs make it all good. It does have GFWL, which is still clunky and terrible, but after getting to grips with it and setting it to auto-login it's stayed out of my way entirely.. could suck if you lose internet for prolonged periods while playing though, since a GFWL connection is used to save your progress. However, I've still really been loving this game and couldn't recommend it heartily enough.

review: Like Giant mechs?  Like Old World War 1/2 technology look?  Like tower defense?  I recommend this game!
